description:
I've eaten here solo and in groups and have always had very good experiences--meals and service. Drinks are good and reasonably priced (although I see some exotic looking tequila bottles on top shelf I'll try sometime). Free very crisp chips with spicy salsa.

Also spicy is the rim on micheladas and the Camarones a la Diabla; both of which I've ordered several times. I'm not sure what the white shrimp are exactly, but they have been tender and their flavor standout even with the very spicy sauce. It makes the other foods I've tried are bland by comparison, which is probably why I often see families with kids here. And the aforementioned spicy salsa can always add the desired kick. Portions are very generous. Waits can be longish here, especially compared to other Celias I've eaten at.
author: Ken U.

description:
It's okay, it's decent.. Nothing too crazy, and nothing to complain about.. 
I went here with some friends and we had some various dishes.. All fine, decent and absolutely okay.. But not too exciting.. If around in the area, I'd come back if I crave Mexican food.. 
Go for the Mexican dishes and stay away from the burger.. Especially the frites were very disappointing.. but the large burritos were good!
author: Nadia S.

description:
Come here maybe for the alcohol, but not their food. Where do I begin??

Service: Horrible. I mean the absolute worst. Slow, inconsiderate, and just damn lazy. Waiters/waitress pass by you and you ask for something, they never come back. Don't waste your time

Food: Overpriced and just terrible. I had my order get messed up so often that it became embarrassing. The manager came out and tried fixing it, but he also messed up. Its just lousy

Ambiance: They have a little tiki bar that attracts people since its close to the "beach" but don't get fooled. Super small little nook for a bar, and the service once again, takes forever to just get a damn Corona. Not to mention there are stacks and stacks of dead flies near every booth with a window.

Parking: Unavailable. You will not find a parking. Best to park 3 or 4 blocks before reaching this joint and make sure to lock your car especially in this neighborhood.
author: Donatello F.

description:
Popped into Celia's for dinner after paying a quick visit to The Woods Outbound next door. Didn't have much in the way of expectations--aside from eating family-style Mexican food, and a lot of it, very quickly. 

Seated almost immediately at prime time on a Wednesday night (so, I guess an "average traffic" time). Our server was quick, chill, and attentive. 

Prices were a little surprising at first, but when the food showed up everything made sense--the portions are COLOSSAL. I ate my face off on vegetarian chimichangas, which were... fine. A little plain, but satisfying and, like I said, colossal. 

Celia's the kind of crowd-pleasing place you can count on to grab a table on short notice, especially when neighboring Outerlands is packed. If the food were a little bit better or the prices a little lower, it would stand out more.
author: Jim M.

description: Fun neighborhood restaurant. The staff is nice. Get your margaritas with top shelf tequila and you'll a-ok.
author: Joanie S.

description:
Mexican restaurant in sunset.
The service was really good.
I tried fish taco combo. The fish wasn't buttered but pretty good. I was satisfied.
Free chips and salsa was good too.
We came in Saturday night 7 ish , waited for 30mins to get a table.
Price is decent. Combo for a $15 ish.
author: Nazuki Y.

description:
Saw a mouse in the restaurant. Enough said. 
They wouldn't even comp our food, said the best they could do was give us manager's discount 30% off. Ridiculous that they treated this so casually..
author: Riley G.

description: Very polite and nice staff but unfortunately really bad food. The restaurant was smelly and dingy. I had chicken Mole. Later that day had some stomach issues but cannot conclusively link it to the restaurant.
author: Sumanth S.

description: Loved this local Mexican restaurant in the Sunset District.   Margaritas were tasty and the specialty Enchiladas Mole was delicious.  It has a very neighborly feel and a friendly vibe.  It fills up quickly so be prepared
author: Mary M.

description: The food was so good! My new favorite Mexican place. The staff service was okay. Waitress didn't check on us often or refill drinks. Would definitely go back!
author: Kelsey Z.

description: I love this place! Feels like a true family restaurant with typical Mexican decor. The margaritas and guacamole are a must. It can get crowded, but I've always had good luck finding a table in the bar area - seat yourself!
author: Cameron C.

description: A bit disappointed in this place. I've gone to a few other Celia's restaurants and Loved them and to be honest I was bummed when I came here! The food was pretty standard- nothing stood out as better than average. The drinks on the others hand were TERRIBLE! I always loved the margs at Celia's and these ones were watered down and basic. I also ordered a michelada and it was literally the worst I've ever had.. it tasted like just beer with a splash of Clamato and didn't even come with a salted rim! Probably won't return back to this place.. bummer.
author: Andrea H.

description:
Terrible food, Great (and very strong) Margaritas! Their Mexican food is less authentic than Taco Bell and also far less delicious, but they give you plenty of warm chips (with free refills) and (really good cilantro-y) salsa on the house, so come for the margs! They usually have drink specials most days of the week, for example Taco Tuesdays they have $5 margaritas (do NOT order their taco Tuesday tacos. They're really tiny and not good), and I went Wednesday and they had $19 pitchers of margaritas. Rocks and blended, same price. So, despite the fact that I have hated everything I've ever ordered to eat here, Celia's margaritas have kept me coming back time and again. Eat beforehand and come ready to drink

Some more specifics on the food. One time I ordered fish tacos and it was just unbattered fish cubes with some pickled jalepenos on top. One time I ordered steak tacos and they gave me steak tacos in a hard shell with some sort of weird mole type thing on top, like what? I assumed by default they'd come in a soft shell, and the waitress did not ask nor did the menu specify. Refried beans are pretty decent. Mexican rice is barely spiced. And again, the taco tuesday tacos are a horrible choice. The barest minimum amount of bland filling in a soft shell about 1/3 the size of a normal taco tortilla.
author: Katie N.

description: Ordered nachos and got ripped off- literally they gave me an 8 inch paper plate for 15.00! Super small and the person who takes the orders isn't very knowledgeable and can't pronounce appropriately the items for you. VERY UNAUTHENTIC AND A rip off.
author: Jenna E.

description: For the price, I was underwhelmed. The burritos just fell flat and were lacking in flavor.
author: Tiffany R.

description:
Staying in the area and was in the mood for some Mexican food.
Sadly, this is not really that.

Got two dishes, but because of poor communication on the menu (not mentioning anything about meat in the enchiladas, until they took our order and I was prompted which meat for the enchiladas...), we chose poorly on meat selections/pairings for our dishes because we had no time to think about it (note to self: carne asada is NOT a good pairing for mole sauce. But I already knew that -- but felt rushed because the mole enchiladas said nothing about meat choices. It also said the beans and rice were vegan, yet the beans had cheese on them... which we like, but is just another example of poor communication/menu. The same poor communication exists for dessert -- it lists "sopapillas" but they are not sopapillas at all -- just a fried flour tortilla. But at least our waiter made sure to forewarn us of that when we ordered it, so we canceled the order before being disappointed.)

They have a good selection of tequilas and mezcal, though, and the tequila flight I had (Ultra Premium flight) was excellent (even if pricey.) The chips and salsa were also good.

The carnitas was pretty bland and (even more importantly) was not moist at all -- too dry.
author: Matthew G.

description: One of those places where you feel held hostage while waiting for food and the check. The food was worse than taco bell. Strawberry margarita was way too sweet and artificial tasting. Too expensive. Service is very slow. Food sub-par.
author: Mary W.

description: I love this place. Our new spot for Mexican foods! Their strawberry Margaritas are great!
author: Bella A.

description: Ok place to meetup with a group. Service is lacking. You have to ask for everything here.
author: ging l.

description:
Taco Tuesday! $1 per taco? Can't beat that!

Yes, for the price only, Celia's is totally worth it. Considering the wait time, not so much. We were told 30 minutes for a table for 2 - we waited for an hour. Staff was friendly and the overall service was fine but not exceptional: we ordered drinks but they unfortunately never came to our table - we just cancelled it when we got our check. The tacos were good, nothing out of the ordinary but for what you're paying for, I think it's pretty good and worth visiting Celia's if you're craving them. The mango tacos were interesting; worth trying as well! And, you get complimentary chips & salsa!

If you really want cheap tacos on a Tuesday, come to Celia's. Just be wary of the wait. My advice? Come early! If it's already crowded, get yourself a drink at the bar while you wait... Unless they forget about your Corona/Margarita...
author: Alex L.

description:
Can't comment on the food because I've been sitting at my table after order for the last 45 minutes waiting for it to come out. I can only comment on the fact that I've actually forgotten what my server looks like because I haven't seen him since he took our order. 

Okay. Food arrived. Had the Taco Tuesday special (mango pork, ground beef, chicken and avocado). Meh.
author: Abe L.

description: Love this place for Taco Tuesday! Great food, drinks and great prices! Amazing service and enjoyed a great evening!
author: Heather G.

description: Not terrible, but certainly not the best Mexican food around. I had their "expresso" burrito--a wet burrito of sorts--that was extremely chewy and bland. Their margaritas taste basically like watered-down cheap tequila. The service was quick and friendly, so not a total loss,  but i probably won't be going back.
author: Raph S.

description: Excellent family style Restaurant in my old Neighborhood. The food is similar to Momma Celia's back in the day! The Nephew (great newphew?) and family are now running this place. They are a good choice for great drinks and great quick bite...I never wait long and I always find the staff excellent..I have always been looked after very well here and all my Irish families! We love to carry on the tradition of eating here since the 1960's!!! Happy Sunset people and love that the old Neighborhood is coming back & starting to thrive again!!SDI lol
author: Joni D.

description:
If you're looking for a good bottomless mimosa spot, this is it! A friend brought me here simply for the mimosas after we had brunch elsewhere and it's quite a hole in the wall. We were seated at the bar seating next to the window, which was nice. For $15 each, we each had five glasses of mimosas. The best part is that it's basically champagne with a splash of OJ. They also have complimentary chips and salsa. The chips were crispy just the way I like them, but the salsa tasted too much like tomato sauce. I'm not sure about the food here, but the mimosas are great!

Note: Sunday bottomless mimosas are from 12-3pm.
author: Cindy Z.

description:
You know when just really want some good old California sit down Mexican food? Celia's is what you need. Is there food amazing? No. Is there plenty of it and all the standard choices? Yes. Beans and rice? Yes. Is it a friendly family atmosphere? Yes. A-ok. I have been many times when I just need my neighborhood Mexican fix and I'm sure will be back. 

Actually, their chips are really good. Perfect crispy and oily. And good salsa too. 

Their taco guess is good to. $2 corona and $3 for 3 standard tacos or $6 for fancy ones. The mango tacos ($6) are actually pretty darn good. And endless chips and salsa.  I'm a fan. 

It does get crowded, but you can wait at the bar and get a drink if you want, so it's not so bad! Thy also have lots of tvs for warriors, 49er, and giants games.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Two words: Taco Tuesday! My roommates come here all the time, and they brought me along once. We put our names down and had to wait around 45 minutes. Fortunately, Pittsburgh Pub is just around the corner, so we enjoyed a drink there then headed back to claim our table.

We were seated in a spacious booth and snacked on chips and salsa (spicy!) while waiting for our margaritas and tacos. Margaritas here are the best. They're incredibly strong, and you can either get an individual drink or a pitcher. Holy crap. The $1 tacos were too rubbery and devoid of meat, but I guess you get what you pay for. Since I live down the street, I'd be down to repeat this experience, but I wouldn't go out of my way to consume anything here, other than the margaritas!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Excellent place to sit down and eat some grub.  The service was incredibly friendly and helpful (offering suggestions or alternatives for food, checking in on our table, and making sure we were generally happy with our experience).  The ambiance was nice; the Giants game was projected right behind our table too (at an angle in which we wouldn't block the view or that it might blind us), so it was even better than having a giant TV.

Food-wise, I think everything was delicious though I admit our table went overboard on appetizers (and the free chips).  Got the sampler plate and the carnitas fries, both of which were  scrumptious.  I ordered the combo plate A (well, whatever had the tamale, taco, and enchilada combo) and a pitcher of margaritas.  The margaritas were pretty darn strong (our table had some experienced drinkers too).  My dinner wasn't exactly fancy or light, but man, it was heavily portioned.

My cautions would be that parking isn't great in the area (I live a few blocks away), and you should be prepared to pay a pretty penny for the food, as most plates go around $15-25.  If you're on a diet, you're probably gonna want to avoid this place.  All in all though, a fun experience.  Would go back, at least for a special occasion.
author: Matthew W.

description:
Terrible, terrible, terrible waitress named Hannah. Rude, rude, rude little girl! Good help is certainly hard to find these days. She's an absolute disgrace! Beware of this bipolar waitress.

On a positive note, Jessica L. a bartender,  makes a mean margarita and she's extremely pleasant! I'd go back and sit at the bar only.
author: This Is M E.

description: OK/Good Mexican food--it's a chain. They have one in Marin, and two in the peninsula. If you're not looking for authentic food and a quick lunch or dinner after a day at the beach, this is the ticket. Good margaritas as well!
author: Virginia C.

description:
I ordered the fajitas and they came with a plate of carrots, zucchini, cauliflower and bell peppers, which was STEAMED. I'd give it negative stars if possible. This is Mexican food like they'd serve in Minnesota in 1955. My girlfriend's plate also had a hair in it.

Edit: the issue isn't that they served vegetables in a vegetarian fajitas, it's that they called rough-cut steamed crudités with no seasoning other than salt fajitas. I can confirm that they comped the plate with hair in it. Which honesty, I don't think is that big of a deal since that kind of thing happens, but it's more evidence of the level of care that goes into their food. And their health score is 88, not 98 like the owner said, see for yourself: https://101g-xnet.sfdph.org:8443/ords/eeopn/f?p=132:2:::NO::P2_LOCATIONID:3594
author: Philip F.

description:
Meh...Not the quality I expect from a family style Mexican restaurant.

Brought an out-of-towner here on a lark to give them an example of Mexican food that is NOT like Taco Bell (which she loves).  Sadly, the quality of the food was not up to par.  We ordered chile verde, a carnitas burrito, and a combo plate with a cheese enchilada, a chile relleno, and a chicken taco.  The default salsa that came with the chips was more like a V-8 with some chopped tomatoes.  Not very flavorful at all.  We had to ask for a spicier salsa, if they had it.  The Chile Verde had an oddly tangy flavor that I've not experienced with any other version of chile verde.  The chile relleno seemed to not be a fresh chile, but a canned chile.  The carnitas burrito seemed to have more rice/beans than carnitas (which was almost non-existent).  The service was great, though.  Friendly, solicitous and accommodating.  I don't think I'll be coming back here, though.
author: Annette B.

description: The food was ok, but nothing spectacular. The restaurant was crazy busy which we took to be a good sign. We waited over an hour until a table for 2 was available. The service was fine, the ambience left something to be desired. Given the quality of the food, it just doesn't seem worth the wait or the money.
author: Ben M.

description: I really want to love this place. Sincerely I do. It's in my hood, it always sounds good when I want Mexican food (which is 4x a week) but man, they just can't get it right. Maybe they should just focus on the bar scene, but the food is a miss on multiple levels. It's fine for families and big groups, but it's not legit Mexican food. At least not quality. It pains me to write these words. I'm waiting for the day it has a sign outside that says "under new management with a new improved menu!" Disclaimer- I've never had their drinks, maybe that's their jam.
author: Rex L.

description:
Super great neighborhood restaurant for good old fashioned California Mexican food. Tasty margaritas in the bar too. A really great place for families or for a night out to happy hour. I love the neighborhood feel of this place - Outer Sunset is like it's own little surf town.
The food is NOT fancy here, but I think it is delicious. I am picky too. But this style of food reminds me of childhood in Southern California eating tacos, beans, rice, etc all of the time.
Warning: The chips and salsa are amazing, so don't fill up before your food comes out. Try a bowl of fresh handmade guacamole to help pace yourself.
author: Dylan L.

description: Food and drinks are delish. Will come back very soon as we arrived when a fundraiser was occurring. Sat next to an obnoxious man mistreating his woman verbally. Other than that, everything else was awesome!
author: Carol C.

description:
I have absolutely not one complaint about this place. Had an amazing time and some great happy hour drinks. Celia's is a cozy Mexican spot that's by Ocean Beach and right next to Outerlands (if you know what that is). The location is awesome because parking is simple to find unlike many parts of the city. 

Service was efficient and super fast. The house blend margaritas got to my table a few minutes after I ordered them and not long after my main meal arrived. The staff here are all friendly and checked up on us often to make sure everything was tasting good- which it definitely was!

The food was incredible. This place seems like it gets a very mixed reception. I keep seeing either 1 star or 5 star reviews. I've been here a few times and every time it's been very tasty. The enchiladas I ordered were cooked to perfection. There aren't many other places that you can get this quality for the price, plus if you come at 4:30-6pm, it's happy hour, which means that margaritas are 5 bucks. You can't beat that.

Final verdict: this spot is located in a nice spot near that beach that sets it up to be a very cozy place. The staff are all friendly and attentive plus the food here is always good. It makes for a very great date night. Worth a visit!
author: Alex B.

description: Great guac and chips but the tinniest veggie burrito I have ever had anywhere in SF. It is too bad, because it did taste good...but for $7 I think it should have been bigger than a taco.
author: Sarah P.

description: I've been to Celia's twice both times when visiting a friend who lives in the outer sunset. For me it's all about Taco Tuesdays but expect a line as understandably half of the neighbourhood seem to be there. The beer is cheap (on Tuesdays) and there is unlimited chips and salsa, which always gets my vote.
author: Matt B.

description:
Great place for discounted drinks on Taco Tuesdays! Where else can you get Coronas for $2 and margaritas for $5? 
Tacos on the other hand, you get what you pay for. 

The house tacos 3 for $3 is a small tortilla with your choice of meat and pico de gallo. Don't get too excited over the price because chances are you'll need more food and will end up paying the similar price as other restaurants that serve you less tacos with generous ingredients.

Very crowded on Taco Tuesday even for small parties. Crowded bar with young adults hanging out sipping on Coronas an margs. 

Unlimited complimentary chips and salsa!
author: Danae L.

description:
This Celia's is tremendous, totally tremendous. I don't know any place on earth better. 
           
                                 -Donald J. Trump
author: Carlos E.

description:
Taco Tuesday is the best here! I've been here a lot and they never disappoint. I like when you check in they give you complementary guac and chips, plus they already give you salsa too! Their taco Tuesday menu is simple, three tacos for $3. You can choose from pork, beef, or chicken (if i can remember). I always get the chicken because it is just so good! Their drink menu is on there too. Margaritas are like $5 on the rocks? 

The general environment here is laid back, there are many tables around and its super lively here. If you come when they open at 4PM, there isn't a wait. I am sure later on they will get packed.
author: Katie L.

description:
I was so sick of me & my friend "enjoying" ourselves at mediocre places like La Playa Taqueria on Noriega/45th Ave and so I scoured for better mexican places in her mexican-desert area on yelp (MANY THANX TO Gohar Z. IN THEIR 3/23/17 LA PLAYA TAQUERIA REVIEW REGARDING GOING INSTEAD TO CELIA'S!!!) and saw all the rave reviews on yelp for Celia's by the beach which was nearby (The 18 bus or N-Judah bus go here), so we went here one afternoon around 4pm.  It was only half full with customers.  They may only have 3.5 stars, but based on our visit there, they should REALLY be in the 4 star and above category!!

The ambiance was FESTIVE, loud, spacious, a large hut inside with spacious tables, comfy 
sofa seats great for groups and even families with kids. They serve many different types of alcoholic drinks along with non-alcoholic drinks.  They even had tvs which were high up near the ceiling but could be easily seen by their large projections against the sides of the restaurant walls. 

The service was EXCELLENT--Our table always had someone asking if we wanted more chips, drinks, etc.  If I asked for another drink, it came in good time. And our meal only took at most 10-15 minutes, all while they made sure we had drinks and nacho chips/salsa appetizers.

The crispy thin chips & mild salsa tasted fresh. The food was pricy at $13.95 for a carnitas burrito, but when it came you could see why--it was HUGE with fresh chopped tomato/sour cream toppings. There was a side of coleslaw.  My friend ordered Nachos with ground beef and for about $10.95 and she had not eaten anything the whole day and EVEN SHE SAID SHE FELT FULL because they give you A LOT!!  She also thought her meal was soooo tasty.  You may want to ask them to add lettuce & rice on your nachos since those were not on the nachos my friend ordered.  Except for the drinks which was about $4 to $5 for VERY SMALL agua frescas, the food was definitely a great value!! I mean, no where in the outer Sunset/Richmond area can you come out with a $35 tab for 2 people for fresh, tasty, high quality MEXICAN food, with generous portions, with excellent service/ambiance. I did NOT think the food was authentic Mexican because the marinade and mexican taste would be more evident such as in Mission St Taquerias, but as a No#1 mexican place in the Ocean Beach/Sunset/Richmond area, it's a #1 Mexican place in MY book-just based on ambiance/service and high quality/generous amt of food.  Even in the Mission district, to find all this in ONE Mexican restaurant is a RARE find!!  It's a DEFINITE must go back to place for us!!  And Next time, I'll get my friend & me to order the mimosas ON THE ROCKS!! -)
author: Frugal C.

description: Two stars for the two bowls of chips & salsa we've consumed while waiting for about 30 mins for food and still waiting.... It wasn't full when we arrived, but now five more groups have sat. H-U-N-G-R-Y.  Ok, food cake and my "fajita quesadilla" (chicken) was $13.25 and edible because I was so hungry. No flavor. This is not representative of the Mexican Food SF/CA has to offer.  Next time I will just go to Taco Bell.
author: Jenna C.

description: This is not a place to go to if you want authentic Mexican food. This is the avenues version of Mexican food. The wait staff didn't check on us after being served. It was a huge plate and not much food. The one good thing I can say about this is they had good chips and salsa. If you want to make your own microwaved cheese quesadilla i recommend you do it in your home microwave! It may taste better there! I usually like Celia's so please step your game up Celia's by the Beach!
author: S B.

description: My wife and I were on vacation in San Francisco, while there we figured we'd try some of the local cuisine. Read many of the Yelp reviews and decided to judge it for ourselves. We went on a Tuesday evening around 6:30. Walked in to a packed restaurant and gave our name to the hostess. We were told it would be 15-20 minutes, which we were ok with. 7:15 rolled around and we still had 3 parties in front of us. My wife noticed people walking in and sitting at the small round tables in the foyer. We inquired about those tables and were told it was a first come first serve section. Why we weren't told this at the beginning, why would they have a section in the middle of the restaurant like that? We ended up swooping up on one of these tables. The service was decent but the hostess didn't know how to do their jobs. Food was also decent, I just know that I would never wait 45 plus minutes for this restaurant ever again on any trips to San Francisco.
author: Eddie K.

description: Honest is earned. Please have a little respect. Don't lie. I have pics of your menu.
author: Hackey S.

description: The food is really great and seems clean. What makes this place great is the happy hour and taco Tuesdays. Whenever I'm craving Mexican, I think of this spot. The rating is 4 stars although due to lack of attention by our server. Every time I go, I get like one refill at most and I like to drink a lot. Every time I went I had to wave down someone else in order to get the check.
author: Ryan T.

description: Yummy! Nice margarida and chips. They accommodate gluten free diners and vegan, too. Majority of the servers are nice and their big screen is nice when you want to watch a game. Nice booth. Great guacamole for people who don't like tomatoes or excessive onion. Very fresh. They stopped putting pork in the pinto beans so it's vegan, but always check to see if they continue that. The black beans are always vegan. The corn tortilla is really nice.
author: R. M.

description: Love love love Celia's! Big portions, fun divey atmosphere and great margaritas! My personal favorites are the chicken fajitas or enchilada combo with a house or coconut margarita. Celia's is our favorite neighborhood spot.
author: Ashley M.

description:
Bottomless mimosas are great. But Bottomless Chips and Salsa?! Plus free Guac for checking in on the Yelp App?? Oh yes! It might even be sweeter than bottomless mimosas, but they serve different purposes. I usually prefer the Celia's in Daly City, but this one was closer to my homegirl's house, so I rolled over.

Headed to the spot last night as my dear friend wanted to take me out for my birthday (two months ago) and this was the first time we both could make it happen. I met her and two other loverly ladies at the bar while we waited for our table. Obviously, the people who you go to dinner with make it a special event and a good time (which we had), but our waitress and really the whole staff was attentive, prompt, and friendly. 

I ordered three soft tacos, one with each kind of meat: shredded chicken, picadillo, and beef. They were very good and I appreciate that Celia's has Tobasco sauce (my fave). My friend had tow crunchy tacos and I immediately wished I got those when I saw the size of mine: seriously *Teeny Tiny*! And if there's one thing I can't stand in this world, it's tacos that are too small. But whatevs, I ate, I drank, I was merry. 

The guac was decent, mixed with salsa and some salt it got a lot better, plus it was free. We all had The Standing Man which is a Carona upside down in their house margarita and it was superb. Happy hour prices are very reasonable, I will surely be back.
author: Crystal C.

description: I'd give the food a 3.5, and the kids eat free night a 5, but the service is SO UNBELIEVABLY SLOW EVERY SINGLE TIME. Always empty tables and a wait none the less. It's like they pride themselves on it. Adequately staff!!
author: Griffen H.

description: Sad to write this.  Served cold food on a hot plate and when I merely suggested something be said to the chef, all I got was a shoulder shrug and a "I don't know".  Seriously?  Can't even muster up a fake apology?
author: Lynne P.

description: Food here was pretty good. Enchilada and chile relleno. I sat at the bar, service was slow and wasn't serviced chips/salsa. Tasteful tequila selection. I'd have to try this place again to reconsider 3 or 5 stars.
author: Will D.

description: The worst tamale I have ever had. I ordered the beef and they said they were out so I was forced to receive the cheese. When the cheese tamale came it was a solid chunk of cheese that tasted like tofu.
author: Justin C.

description:
I love coming here for Taco Tuesdays, 
I order avocado tacos with a side of rice/beans complimented with a house margarita on the rocks. Simple and delicious. 
Celias is family run and has great history in the bay area as a business. 

Definitely recommend! 5 Stars every-time,
They even host after hours dance parties with a dj and its crackinn after special events like OSL
author: Caroline R.

description: This was our second time going to this place. First time went really well. I guess it depends on the server you have. Our server the first time was amazing. On time with food, refills, and checked in on us every now and then. Well, the second time we went, we ended up with a waitress. Evening was going well in the beginning. I ran out of my coke and I never got a refill.   She brought the food, and noticed our cups were empty, didn't even bother to refill our drinks. 25 minutes passed by before a different server who passed by our table asked us if we needed our drinks to be refilled. Second of all, the area we were sitting had windows and on the window ledge there were several dead flies. I am talking about 15 at minimum. I hope next time, we get a different person to serve us.
author: Mark Q.

description:
Went there for taco Tuesday and I've never had more underwhelming tacos in my life. 

I'm vegetarian and got the veggie house tacos. They were truly street taco style size (ate them in 2 bites). There's was a total lack of imagination and effort in making them. It was a flour tortilla, two slices of Avacado and pico de gallo. THAT'S IT. No beans or flavor.  Won't be going back for tacos. Just go to mission for your Mexican food needs. Lesson learned. 

My friends got the other taco options and were not impressed. But I won't make any further comment on items I didn't eat.
author: Soumya G.

description:
I originally came to outer sunset to go to the restaurant next door, outerlands. The wait time there was over an hour, and the restaurant was super trendy.

We put our name down at celia's, and boy am I glad we did. The food was excellent - i ordered the chile verde, which was huge!

The margarita with coconut tequila was amazing. I ordered it on the rocks without salt.

I did have to minus 1 star because the service was so slow. we were just sitting for 20 minutes before they cleared our plates. it seemed like they were understaffed.
author: Kailey O.

description:
Tip that I wrote after I picked up my food:
Site said to pick up order at 8:04p. Waited til 830p before I finally got my order with no real update the whole time I was there. Hostess was no help at all and had no idea what she was doing! Saw someone drop off a to go order at the front. Had to ask her if it was mine. She didn't know and made me wait even longer! Would have completely cancelled the order if I hadn't already pay for it. Plus I would have had to wait to do it! So annoyed!!!

Okay that was completely written out of frustration. I understand that restaurants can get busy. I grew up in one. But communication should be the key when food is lagging right?! They could have called if they were running behind. Or they could have given us an ETA when we got there. Instead they just made us wait with no update whatsoever.

After all this I really wanted to enjoy some Mexican food. Boy was I disappointed! Almost everything was super bland and dry. I basically drenched everything in hot sauce so I could eat it.  That was the only way to make anything palatable!

The Expresso burrito was the worse. The carnitas had the texture of jerky, but not the awesome flavor of jerky. Not what you would want from a wet burrito! So super hard and chewy!!!

Everything else was simply bland even though it was covered in sauce. The chicken in my enchiladas was dry. The chimichanga was super doughy and nothing else. The chile relleno had no flavor. The taco and carne asada were the best of the worst. Both managed to retain some flavor and the taco shell some crunchiness.  But this didn't make up for the rest of the food.

Honestly I would have given this place 2, maybe 2.5 stars based on the food, but since the service was so horrendous, I bumped it down to 1. And I hardly ever give 1 star to any establishment. Maybe I went on an off night. But there was really no redeeming quality about this place. Maybe they should rethink doing take out since they get such great reviews from people that eat there. I really do feel bad, but I gotta write an honest review!
author: Elena N.

description: Very good Mexican in a fun, loud environment. Great margaritas. And Shalott us we says and fajitas were very good. Service was excellent and attentive. I recommend.
author: Greg G.

description: Food was yummy it's really hard to impress a mexican with Mexican food ... Well let me tell you I loved it! It's  real  authentic Mexican food!
author: Veronica S.

description: Cheap tacos and beer and good taco tuesday vibes, but the tacos are too small for my taste. They're not bad but hardly enough food. My friend and I had to order a second plate of three. The wait wasn't too bad and the service was really good. Might come back and try some of the other food items.
author: David C.

description: Pretty good food. Usually a bit pricy for what you get (most of the better burritos in town cost almost 50% less) but it's a decent deal on tacos and margaritas on taco Tuesday, and the atmosphere is kinda cool.
author: Dakota S.

description:
Second worst Mexican food I have ever eaten in my life. Please do not eat here. What a soulless and horrible place. How did a Latino let food that bad leave the kitchen? I am literally speechless. This is a insult to Mexicans and our cuisine. Our food is cheap and should be flavorful and plentiful. Flavorless 

Guacamole was tasteless. No salt? No flavor? How can you screw this up? Disgusting. Ugh. 

Who serves fajitas with undercooked potato? Cauliflower? Is that cheap butter you cooked them in? Who cooks fajitas ingredients in butter or margarine? What do you do with these big ass pieces of weird non Latino veggies? 

Corn tortillas? Four? They cost nothing! What pathetic amount of beans and rice is that!?! It costs nothing! Nothing! 

No hot sauce in sight? You have to ask for hot sauce? 

Why is the water glass child sized?   

The menu is some twisted version of Chevys. How are the prices for an single enchilada with nothing $5? 

I can't even explain how much this food hurt me. This was the second worst eating experience I have ever had in the Bay. 

The worse Mexican food I have ever had is....GASP a place called "Celias" in San Rafael that gave me food poisoning. When I looked at the wall of pictures, I realized THEY MIGHT BE RELATED. THEY MIGHT BE BRINGING HORRIBLE MEXICAN FOOD NEAR YOU. 

AHHHHHHHHHHHHHH

El Farolito. Picantes. You know.
author: Chompy S.

description: Yum! great ambiance and service. Fun place!
author: Michelle W.

description: Every time I go to the beach I crave Celias after.  It is just such delicious food. All sports games broadcasting walls in hi def. it's great for kids oh my ask for a la Diabla sauce. It is just such a great family spot!!!
author: Monique P.

description: Love this place! Cozy neighborhood feel, always filled with locals and regulars. Great place for big parties (even up to 40 plus people). The food is traditional Mexican food and is super delicious and filling. I usually get a traditional combo, mostly the #1, #6, or the #10. All have been great so far. The staff is all really sweet as well :)
author: Hayley D.

description: The worst service ever. My daughters 15th Birthday and she cried it took so long.  3 hours!!! What the heck happened this place used to be awesome !!  Never again. The worst.
author: Laura D.

description: I really liked my food and the atmosphere. The staff I encountered were very helpful, and pretty quick too. I was impressed with the atmosphere because it was family friendly, (I had my 2 year old niece with me), yet it was very fun and boisterous. I recommend this place for some good fun and good food :)
author: Alicia F.

description: Love this place ! It is our local spot for Taco Tuesday and pretty much any and everyday of the week. Staff is killer , Alex is normally our server and he is the best. Super friendly and nice. Margs are on point always get the Milagro and fresh lime juice pitchers. Tacos are the way to go and always guac. Best spot for the Warriors , Giants , and Niners. Love this neighborhood spot, old school and always awesome !!
author: Jackie J.

description:
Long wait, horrible service, lackluster food. 
I'd rather drive to the mission and pay half the price for a decent enchilada
author: Lisa L.

description: Do you want a burrito? Do you want to spend 15$ on a burrito? Come here and all of that can come true. Want to sit in and make that burrito 20$? $25 with a drink? Anything is possible at celias!
author: Shreen G.

description: Good margaritas. Standard food. Casual atmosphere.
author: Anjolie C.

description: I ordered the avocado tostado and it was really bad. The taco was stiff and there was so much lettuce it was like eating a plain lettuce salad on a hard shell taco. The 2 mini slices of avocado were good and the beef was okay but I hardly had any because it just wasn't good. But the service was really great
author: Carmel G.

description:
Taco Tuesday! The reason why my bf and I keep coming back. Soft tacos- 3 for $3, hard tacos (bigger) 2 for $5. Mexican handstand (margarita with beer) $5. Check in for free small guacamole!

I always get the hard tacos because I get full from the unlimited chips and salsas and the hard tacos are pretty big which come with a small helping of coleslaw. 

My bf gets the Cancun Platter which comes with shrimp, crab, chicken, mushrooms (all in an amazing sauce), plus rice, beans, coleslaw, and tortillas. It is absolutely delicious and HUGE! Oh I also get pretty full from picking at his food too ;D

Funny story- we came here most recently for taco Tuesday and my bf ordered 6 tacos, two of each meat (chicken, shredded beef, and ground beef). When he got his food, he noticed one taco was all cheese. When we told the waiter, he told the cook and we heard a huge laugh from the kitchen. A few minutes later they brought an extra taco out for us. Haha

During baseball season (go Giants!), when the game is on and the Giants hit a home run, you get a free shot. BUT you have to be sitting at the bar... where the bartender is. Apparently the bar "area" doesn't count. We've been denied two shots from two home runs in one game. :(

Service is pretty good. Once you sit down, they give you chips and salsa before they give you the menu. Score! And the waiters and waitresses are pretty awesome.

Sometimes we come on other days of the week but Tuesday is most worth it.
author: Arleen F.

description: Went for taco tuesday here! The greatest deal is 3 tacos for $3. From there they have other deals. The tacos are small, but really good. The mango tacos are the best!I recommend eating something small before coming here, because you might be waiting for an 1 hour or 2 hour.
author: Katherine P.

description: We went on a Friday night.  Great food!  Great service!  I saw the posts about bad service.  It was not a problem.  We'll be back!
author: Richard W.

description: Celia's is one of my favorite places in the whole city. It's nestled in the Outer Sunset, right by the beach, and the food and service are always phenomenal. Friendly workers and definitely my favorite enchiladas. Even the chips are exceptional, and I think they have a Ms. Pac-Man machine... but even if they don't anymore, worth your money!
author: AJ P.

description:
What's not to love about Celia's? They have unlimited chips and salsa. Amazing margaritas. And HUGE portions! 

It can get busy on weekends and Taco Tuesday, so expect a wait. But the what is definitely worth it!

And check in on Yelp to receive free guacamole!
author: Lisa H.

description: We planned our UCSF visit specifically around being able to get to Celia's (by the Beach).  Last time we had appointments, it was a Monday and they were closed.  So bummed.  We were staying in Mill City at that visit and we were told that there was a Celia's there....SO NOT THE SAME!!  Very disappointing!  We LOVED our dinner last night.  We only wish that we had asked them to put aside a couple FLANs for us!  The FLAN at this Celia's is the real deal!!   Sometimes in restaurants, you can tell that they have been frozen and they run all over the plate, but not at this Celia's, it is as if your Spanish Grandmother (or great grandmother) spent hours making it!!. However they were sold out when we did ask.  We were staying at an Airbnb, and took frozen ice cream with the caramel sauce back for dessert, also delicious!  It was Taco Tuesday with the $5.00 house margarita, but I knew I wanted the top shelf Margarita, that I LOVED the last two times we ate at this Celia's...did not dissapoint!  Between us we had three.  We ordered off of the menu rather than having tacos!  Everything was EXCELLENT as we knew it would be!!  We will see you next time we have appointments at UCSF.  This is a MUST stop on our trips!!
author: 4oregonz Z.

description: I highly recommend Celia's. The food is good and the prices are reasonable.
author: Jenn C.

description: I love this place! It's my go to. My fiancé and I were hanging at the bar tonight and a bartender (Stephen) was so awesome to chat with. He's super funny and his presentation while making drinks is way awesome. Keep up the good work, Celias!
author: Em O.

description: OMG get the hard shell tacos. I've had them at least 10 times and they are just the best thing ever.
author: Sarah S.

description:
I feel like anyone who rates this place higher than 1-2 stars has never had good Mexican food. We've lived like a block away from this place for 4 years and never gone...now I know why. 

We shared the chicken fajitas and some guacamole to go with our chips and salsa.

The guacamole incredibly tasteless. My 8 month old son, who usually loves avocado and guac, gagged on it for some reason, and he eats everything. We had to dump the salsa in it to make it palatable.

The entree was the most uninspired Mexican food we've ever had. The only flavor was salt and a slight essence of 'grilled'. The beans were uninteresting - baby didn't like those either, even though refried beans are usually a hit. Maybe our expectations were too high?

The margarita (blended, salt) was okay. Our waitress was very nice, though she gave us the wrong check at the end of the night - but that was an easy fix, no big deal. The service was kinda slow overall and the atmosphere was alright - the baseball game was enjoyable. The portions were big, but even so, everything was way overpriced. 

HOWEVER, there is a pretty cool mural on one wall. I'd give it half a star more for that.
author: Carly G.

description: Sorry to say... My family and I will stop coming here for a while.  It's the ump-teenth time this has happened and I just can't stand it.  Service was much better last year, but this past year their service staff has been terrible.  While they are good about giving chips, they seem to be awful at remembering to take your order and getting your food.  Maybe they are over-worked and forget to take orders from customers waiting like me for more than 10 minutes.  Already on a few visits this has happened.  On one occasion not too long ago the server forgot my friend's food!  It had been sitting in the counter for a while like maybe 15 minutes.  Unacceptable!  However, the drinks are good, but a lot of other places serve great drinks, too.  The management staff has to crack down on bad service.  Sorry Celia's...  but my family cannot go back until the service improves.  :(
author: Vespa V.

description:
Good Margaritas
Average Tacos
Friendly Staff

Taco Tuesdays are great but come early or make a reservation as space does fill up very quickly.
author: Joe K.

description:
My bestfriend and I had been craving mexican food for a while and we were going to go to El Techo but there was traffic on a Friday night and the parking on the mission isn't so great so we decided to stay closer.

Celia's was perfect. We walked in, got seated right away, chips and salsa! *salsa was amazeballs, I would come here just for the salsa, it's seasoned perfectly and has a good amount of tomatoes and onions. 0 m g, I can't take it...* I also had ordered guacamole for the chips but it was so plain. Like avocados just whipped up and nothing else, it was pretty bland for guacamole. 

I got an enchilada with green sauce, and it was so delicious... the chicken enchilada wasn't dry, just the perfect amount of seasoning and juicyness. The sauce on top was perfect with the rice and beans. 

My bestfriends burrito was huge and she only ate half. 

As far as the food gets its pretty good, the service is good as well. I will be back for more enchiladas!
author: Crystal C.

description:
I have eaten here many times, and enjoyed it. Tonight I got food poisoning from them- being the only thing I've had since a granola bar it's safe to say it was them. My husband called to talk to the manager who was rude, dismissive and obviously didn't know the facts about food poisoning or safe food handling. 

Being that my husband works in food, we tried to give them the chance to check up on their food so no.one else got sick. Due to the rude and incompetent handling of the situation we are turning to the department of health.

I am very sad because we have enjoyed them so much in the past that we were not trying to do anything other than warn them. Now that I know they do not care one bit about their customers I will be following up with the authorities.

Pretty shady when we asked to speak to management the man REFUSED to give his name. Guilty much?

Thanks for the crippling diarrhea and vomiting!
author: CJ P.

description: Big portions, good food, friendly staff and great margaritas! The food is really reasonable, especially for Taco Tuesday but expect a crowd. Also, Wednesday's are family night. The back room near the restrooms becomes a playroom. AVOID if you're trying to have a relaxing meal!
author: Shannon D.

description:
Came here with a group of around 20 and had a space in the back just for ourselves.  The Warriors were playing in a playoff game and so the atmosphere was exciting and fun UNTIL the hostess told us to keep the noise down because we were having drinks and watching the game that THEY put on.  What did they expect? It's the playoffs!  We dismissed the hostess' request due to its absurdity.  Then the hostess came a 2nd time and then a waiter came and said,  "you are being spiteful, please keep it down". 

Are you freaking kidding me? You are going to broadcast the game,  serve us drinks, and talk to us like that?? 

Never going back.  Food sucked as usual.  Drinks were ok.
author: Don C.

description:
The top shelf margarita was awesome but the food left something to be desired. Just kind of meh, but ok for the price. 

Location was fun. Yelp description of a Mexican restaurant / sports bar is pretty accurate. Waited about 20 mins for a table for two on a Friday night, which wasn't bad. Pretty much the most exciting place we passed in Outer Sunset that night, which was our main pull for trying it out. 

The take out container was a paper plate with tinfoil wrapped around it. Hadn't seen that one before. Was afraid it would leak in my bag, but they did a pretty good job with it. 

Would go back for the drinks though any time.
author: Brian B.

description:
OMG, what a fucking shit show. My partner and I who are regulars there recently had the worst service in our lives. After ordering two starters, waited over an hour for quesadilla and fajitas. I went to the window at the kitchen and said "really and hour for quesadilla and Fajitas?" 

The head cook and co-owner of the place (which I recognized from past visits) said they were short staffed and told me I was rude for approaching the kitchen. Really? Is it my problem that you are short staff? Waiting for an hour for food when the restaurant is not busy,

You guys had a good run, we wont return.
author: Frederick S.

description: Zzz. Nothing was BAD, per se. I'm pretty sure I won't get dysentery, the food was cooked--even warm--the chicken was recognizable as such and the beans weren't half bad. But, DANG--it was nasty! This is Mexican food with bleach blonde hair and blue contact lenses, if you catch my drift. Hard shell tacos with ground beef in them. If that's normal Mexican food to you then I'm just so sorry and I hope your parents take responsibility for your psychiatric bills. No use churning up those bad memories at this place. You're better than that.
author: Mario T.

description: Not much a lot of Mexican food in the Outer Sunset so this is one of the few options. The prices are kinda high but they sorta make up for it with big portions. The surf and turf fajitas were decent. The mole was not that great. Lots of TVs, so it's a good place to catch the game.
author: Sherry L.

description:
#OnlyGiving1StarBecauseICantGive0

Don't ever come here if you're in a hurry.

My wife and I stopped through on our way home from the beach for what we thought would be a quick and easy to-go order of tacos and enchiladas.  The bartender told me to order from the hostess, who then said the food would be ready in about 15 minutes.  I've never been to a Mexican restaurant that took longer than 5 minutes, but okay.

After waiting for 45 MINUTES and the hostess dodging me and pretending to be busy, we got our food and no surprise, it wasn't anything to write home about.  Definitely will never go back.
author: Matt B.

description: Very disappointed with my service here..My daughter called in a take out order and the woman on the phone said our order would be ready in 30 minutes.  She went in and the woman said come back in 15 minutes. My daughter again went in 15 minutes later and the woman said she knew nothing about our takeout order. She was also very rude with her and unhelpful. She didn't make any effort to make up for their incompetence nor did she try to remedy the situation whatsoever. What a complete waste of our time. We went to El Toreador on West Portal after where our order was  ready on time. El Toreador does not hire stupid people. We will not go to Celia's after this experience again and I recommend others steer clear as well.
author: John F.

description: Fool me once shame on me, fool me five times and I'll take my IBS elsewhere. Recently moved to the neighborhood and really wanted this to be a spot. In short, mediocre food and service. Will wait for some grand reopening before trying again.
author: Ryan S.

description: California burrito was legit. My friend ordered a burger but was served a chicken burrito which was a bummer. Chips and salsa were hella good. Took a while to get food after we ordered.
author: Shaun P.

description:
I went to Celia's on a Saturday night just because I wanted to try a restaurant in the neighborhood, and I was not disappointed! I try to support my local businesses, and, seeing as I live just a few blocks away, I decided to give Celia's a try. 

We got in and I put my name down for two, and we were told that it would be a fifteen minute wait. We were fine with that, so we went to the bar area and ordered some drinks. A server came over to us, cleaned our table, and brought some chips and salsa, good service! The salsa was really good too! After waiting about fifteen minutes, we were given a table.

I ordered the enchilada and chile relleno plate, and my girlfriend ordered the enchilada and taco plate. My girlfriend doesn't like spicy so she couldn't finish her taco, if you aren't a fan of spicy, don't get the shredded beef, but we both enjoyed the enchiladas and my chile relleno was very tasty! It is a bit more expensive than your grab and go Mexican, but it won't break the bank.

Lastly, I really like the decor! The colors, art work, light fixtures, and murals really give it a lively vibe. All in all, if you go to Celia's you'll get pretty good Mexican food which isn't too expensive, great service, and a great restaurant experience in my opinion! Check it out!
author: Brendon P.

description: If I lived in the neighborhood this would be my bar. We ran Bay 2 Breakers and bar crawled back to downtown. Celia's was our first stop. Aidan, the bartender, knows his Tequila. Next time I'm out on Judah defiantly coming back. Actually, I may make a special trip just to come here.
author: Richard B.

description:
To keep this short and sweet I 
Came by here a few weeks ago and the tacos during happy hour were okay... Nothing amazing :-( the atmosphere was very casual, the waiters were quick on their feet and friendly, and the drinks were really tasty actually. I'd come back for the drinks only...
author: Rachel V.

description: Great Mexican style food off the beaten path. Hella busy, but the service was still quick
author: Peter F.

description: I love this place, it's a great little Mexican Restaurant in the Outer Sunset.  They have great margaritas and the atmosphere is pretty lively. If it's game day you will most likely have to wait for atleast an hour tho, but it's sooo worth it.  Favorite dish so far I've had is the chicken fajitas.  I only wished they served queso, other than that this is a regular spot for me when I am crazing my mexican fix.
author: Maggie M.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here the other night and absolutely loved it!

We always base if we like our Mexican restaurants on their chips and salsa. Celias' chips and salsa was great! The guy even asked if we wanted to try the other home made salsas the restaurant has to offer (get the green one - so good)! 

We ordered 2 house margaritas and shrimp ceviche to start with and it was just perfect. The lime juice marinade was refreshing and the shrimp were very fresh and juicy. The margaritas were just right and I was pretty shocked it was a "house margarita."

I really wanted to try their "wet" espresso sauce on my burrito. I asked my waitress what she thought of it and was surprised with her honesty. She told me she wasn't too big of a fan of wet burritos and the sauce itself and recommended that I get it on the side. I ordered the shrimp burrito with the sauce on the side and it came out amazing! Mind you, I was just getting better from the stomach flu and completely devoured my burrito! So good! There were plenty of shrimp inside and the only thing I wish was if the waitress asked what kind of beans I wanted inside (I guess I should have remembered to specify black beans). My boyfriend has their taco and enchilada special and loved it! There wasn't a piece of rice on his plate!

All in all, great dining experience! I will definitely be coming back and can't wait to come on Tuesday nights for Taco Tuesday!
author: Anastasia N.

description:
Enchilada and chimichanga and ask for diabla sauce on the side.

Great service as always.  No reservations need.

Refried beans are hella good.  Oh snap.  Kids eat free on Wednesday.  Oh snap.

Lovely hostess and awesome server.
author: Kevin L.

description: Not very good at all. I went there for taco tuesday. The taco I had tasted like way too much cumin and chili powder. Go to the mission for the good stuff.
author: Lloyd E.

description: My wife and I were craving Mexican food, but our friends didn't want to go far from where they live in Outer Sunset, the compromise was Celia's. Really good for what it is: sit down, decent bar-style mexican food with nice boozy margaritas. Chips and guac were spot on. Chile Verde, which I normally don't order unless I know it's top notch, was actually really satisfying. Big ol' platters with rice and beans and fluffy tortillas. What's not to like?
author: Miles K.
Brian J.

description: I came here for dinner, overall the food was good. There was a lot of food for the price. When I asked for a box, the guy came back saying there was no boxes. I was like really no takeout boxes?! I never been to a restaurant where they didn't have boxes unless they ran out. The guy gave me a paper plate with foil.
author: Alix J.

description:
This used to be our favorite Mexican restaurant outside of San Diego. It was great because we live nearby, so it was a great place to go if we weren't feeling up to making dinner. I would have given Celia's 5 stars before, but in the past few months we've had a few bad experiences that really left us in disbelief. I wonder if management has changed or something last year?

During our visit in October, the tostada salad was one of the most disgusting things I've ever tried. I ordered it vegetarian with no beans and no sour cream. It came out vegetarian but with beans and sour cream, plus it looked terrible. I sent it back and after a few minutes, what looked like a chef or manager or someone came out and asked me what was wrong with it and claiming it was what I ordered. I explained my order and after a bit of arguing, he went back to the kitchen. A new one came out after my boyfriend was almost done with his meal...

The most disgusting part was literally everything about the salad. The tostada was tiny, wet, soaked with oil and limp. The lettuce was cheap shredded taco lettuce. Half the vegetables were cooked, so the finely shredded lettuce got warm and limp fast. There was a single piece of broccoli and it tasted incredibly rancid. There was melted cheese on the bottom of everything, so it stuck to the plate. It was so bad and I already felt guilty for sending it back in the first place, so I ate not even a quarter of it.

Next visit in November: I left the October visit behind me, because I was positive we would have a better visit to my previously favorite Mexican restaurant... The service was slower than ever. It was so bad, I watched a table in the back of the room get upset with the waiter then walk out (I guess they were waiting a long time, too). My mom ordered fajitas and the flour tortillas never came until the end, so they were dessert I guess? Everything bad that could have happened, really did. I don't think our waiter was to blame. I think the kitchen was backed up or they were understaffed or something.

Basically it leaves me to believe this restaurant had some bad change happen, so now we won't be going back, unless if management changes again maybe. I miss the old wait-staff we used to see. I didn't recognize any of the staff the past 2 times we came here.
author: Nic E.

description:
We got seated...after 2 hours on taco Tuesday. It was good but they said wait was at most 1 hr. We came in at 7 PM (feels like am) and it's now 9:45 and we still haven't gotten our tacos. The only thing they were good at was at the bar. Not trying to be rude but shit they for sure skipped us/didn't think we were important customers. Drinks are cheap...tacos are cheap...but be prepared to be put last on their list if you are a fairly large party. Good luck!

Update: still have not received our tacos... it is 10:00 (PM)
author: Brittany O.

description: Exactly what a Mexican restaurant should be. Great vibes, salsa, and mole sauce. Love this spot!
author: Emily F.

description:
Four of us came here for dinner on a Friday, arriving at 6pm. From the crowd in the bar area, the restaurant seemed busy and we had to wait about 15 min for a table. Once we were called, we were led into the main dining room and there were plenty of empty tables so not sure why we had to wait.

We were quickly brought chips and salsa but it took a while for our waitress to appear to take our orders. Once she arrived she was on point with our drinks and food orders. My pork chili verde was really good along with my "grande" house margarita - you could actually taste the tequila. Others in our group also enjoyed their meals

Celia's is going to be my new go to place for sit down Mexican food
author: Bumble B.

description:
They've got a sweet guac check-in offer. I think avocados are gross, but the general population seems to disagree with me, so eat up. 

I can only speak to their salty blended margs, chips and smoky salsa and Ms. Pacman. I love Ms. Pacman. I am the best at Ms. Pacman. 

My experiences here are always *the most* amusing. Where else can one be metres from the beach drinking margs with some cool cats and taking in an NHL playoff game? Nowhere.
author: Evelyn A.

description:
Arrived here on a Saturday night around 7 something. It was pretty busy, parking was hard to come by.
We ordered a corona, a strawberry margarita, and two waters.
For food we ordered the guacamole appetizer, the California burrito and the enchiladas verdes combo.
We were served chips plus salsa and our drinks extremely fast. Our order was taken promptly.
The margarita was pretty sweet, wish I just got the house version. But decent none the less.
The guacamole came out really fast and was creamy and delicious. For over 6 dollars the portion was small, but as visitors we have learned San Fran is expensive no matter what.
The California burrito is huge and was told that it was tasty. If you don't know what one is, it's just a burrito with fries in it. Pretty tasty.
My combo was excellent. Big portion and great flavor. I got one cheese enchilada and one chicken. I think I would just get cheese if we ever come back.
The service all in all was responsive and quick.
Though, we paid a little over 50 for just the two of us. That's pretty crazy to us, that's why we deducted a star. But if you're all for it, then go for it!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
Chicken for tortillas was very dry. Shrimp burrito was ok.

The bar looks like a ton of fun. That's where everyone was sitting. 
Very much looks like a family go -to restaurant. 
Locals. A place to chill.

Specials on certain weekdays. I love it when restaurants offer happy hours!

As of 2015:

Tues- $1 tacos (4 diff kinds, really small, you can probably eat 8 of them) & $6 margaritas (strong!)

Wed- $20 margarita pitchers
author: Veranna N.

description:
This weekend I visited Celia's for the first time. Decent Mexican food with tasty vegetarian substitutions. Strong margaritas and salsa that was happily mild enough for me to handle (I have a pretty low spice tolerance). Large food and drink menu. Nice decor.

The restaurant unfortunately had the faint stench of an old dirty mop. As soon as I walked through the front door sort of foyer area, I smelled it strongly, and the smell grew fainter once we got to our table. The smell was strong again in the bathroom. I've worked in restaurants before, so I'm familiar with the smell of mop... A mop that has some food particles stuck in the fibers, a mop that never really completely dries. You know. It's kinda gross. I have a pretty sensitive nose, and my boyfriend didn't notice the smell at all, so it's definitely not a reason to skip Celia's. 

Next time we're by the beach, we'll come back to Celia's!
author: Jay E.

description:
Last night I had a dream that I was carrying around a big sack of tortilla chips - I think my subconscious was telling me that I craved Celia's. (Actually, it was my thoughtful BF who remembered my dream and suggested we dine here tonight.)

Celia's hit the spot with it's comfort food, mellow atmosphere and friendly and appreciative vibe. Upon entering, we were greeted with a smile and shown to our table in the main dining room. It was warm and thawed us out from the cold outdoors. I like the indoor fountain and hut decor, and it feels like you're walking into a relative's home. This room hasn't changed much since it's renovation; most of the upgrade was done to the entrance and bar area. 

Our server, Sasha was kind and very efficient. She regularly came by to refill our waters, chip bowl, and salsa, and our food come out quickly. Tonight's chicken tostada was spot on. The meat was tender and flavorful and the fresh veggies were a good pairing - iceberg lettuce, tomato, avocado, plus beans, sour cream, salsa and melted cheese. In addition to shredded chicken, this dish comes with an option of picadillo (shredded beef), ground beef, or cheese. In the future, I'll order this without the tostada - I'd eat it with the chips since the tostada tends to get soggy. 

On our way out, the staff showered us with thank yous. I'm appreciative of this wonderful service and wish more establishments were like this. Thank you Celia's!
author: Cathy K.

description: It smells like a public pool in this restaurant. Also the worst Mexican food I have ever had in San Francisco.
author: Jeff C.

description:
I started this review in October, apparently, but never finished it. The only sentence I wrote was "Decent Mexican place, nothing special, but--" 
I actually don't have anything else to say beyond that. I've been here a few times, once for a bottomless mimosa brunch with my bf to watch the Niners game. That was pretty cool because I got to drink a ton of mimosas and munch on chips, so I can't complain. The Mexican food is really nothing to write home about, but the service is very friendly and attentive, and of course, those bottomless mimosas and chips are a steal.
author: Jacqueline K.

description: I went here one time before in the past and had a great time overall, so I was excited to come a second time. Unfortunately I was greatly let down. We were the first to arrive, be seated, and order. We had simple enough order, two burritos, yet we were the last to be served. People were already finishing with their meals when we asked about our food. Even though we allotted plenty of time to eat out and have time for our other commitments, we waited so long, that we had to ask for our food to go and STILL barely got our food in time. The waiter apologized and applied a 6$ discount, which put the total at around $30 which is still greatly overpriced considering the experience we had.
author: Dylan A.

description: I'm very disappointed! I'm doing you guys a favor and don't wasted your money! I ordered take out and few hours later I threw up. Please do yourself a favor by not eating there! I'm definitely not coming back and the nachos were not worth the price I paid!
author: Linh P.

description: OK Mexican food-not authentic though. The enchiladas were good but the shrimp taco was disappointing. The organic margarita was not that good either. I tried it because of the other yelp reviews recommending it but I wasn't a fan of it. For the price, I was expecting more. The location sucks as there is no parking-but than again that's San Francisco in general but be prepared to walk or Uber there. Service was great-our waiter was very attentive. Overall an OK spot to eat if your in the area since there isn't too many restaurants around this specific area.
author: Mayra Z.

description:
Wanted to take my buddy to dinner at Celia's. Been going there for DECADES. Greeter said 25 minutes. We sit and wait. Finally a small table opens up and a couple that had just walked in the door sit at it. I ask the greeter what's up? OH, that's OPEN SEATING... Now you tell me. WTF. 

A guy had come to pick up his phone order. Not ready. Twenty minutes more she says. He pays for it and leaves. He comes back. It will be another twenty minutes she says without batting an eye. 

What a horrible greeter this young person is. I let her know my opinion and we ended up leaving hungry. 

There are PLENTY of places to spend my dollars at that treat the customer better. BTW... I have been going to this Celia's since 1960!!!
author: Steven S.

description:
Really dug our food and margaritas. 

I ordered the #4, with a shredded beef taco and cheese enchilada. Both were delicious. My wife had a ground beef taco and a fish taco. Again, both were delicious. My nephew ordered the #2 with a chicken taco and shredded beef taco. I'm not sure I need to mention what he thought of them but, being that this is a review, I will: both were delicious. The beans and rice and flour tortillas were also (you guessed it) delicious. 

The only reason they didn't get five stars from me is because they no longer give free guacamole for Yelp check-ins...even after a raving review like this one. Oh well, four out of five is still pretty strong.
author: Randy M.

description:
The new location is a spectacular addition to the SF community.  I came to this location before it was renovated and revitalized with the "by the beach" addition... and the improvements that have been made make it a real bay area treasure.

Not only do they have fantastic drink choices and tequila flights but they also have a great Happy Hour!  My sister and I came in the other night and tried nearly everything on the cocktail menu and La Bonita & the Margarita really stood out.  

Food wise, Celia's really hits a home run for me.  Literally.. right when I got my plate Buster Posey hit a home run... JK haha.  But really the food is fresh and flavorful.  My sister and I shared the Carnitas plate and the Cancun platter which is incredible and highly recommended!  And the free chips and salsa are hard to say no to.  My sister and I felt like we were going to pop at the end of the meal, and still we left with leftovers.

They cater to the Giants fan crowd as well which contributes to making Celia's by the beach not only a great food joint...but an overall enjoyable place to be.  My sister and I received a free shooter while we were at the bar because they offer shooters whenever a Giants player hits a home run.

The service is wonderful as well!  I need to come back on a Taco Tuesday night because they have great specials and a Mango salsa taco that I need to try before my head explodes!  

This place has truly been rejuvenated and is absolutely worth a visit... or 10!
author: Amanda L.

description:
I had originally picked Outerlands for our Sunday 1 PM group lunch, but neglected to get reservations. (My logic: surely that would be after any lunch rush ...) Anyway, my husband and I were starving- even contemplating the rather sketchy "Golden Gate Pizza & Indian Cuisine" place- but ended up choosing Celia's instead. Coincidentally, the last time we'd gone out to eat with these same friends, it had been to Celia's as well- one of the Peninsula locations.

Anyway: the four of us had a great time! Our waitress was really nice, and we were able to luxuriate in a long lunch, catching up with our friends, and enjoying decent and utterly satisfying Mexican food. Our party included an infant, so we tried to isolate ourselves in one side of the back room. It ended up being a really relaxing meal ... we never felt rushed for time, or embarrassed by the baby's (admittedly few) unhappy moments.

We started off with sangria (for the dudes) and virgin mango margaritas (for the ladies). I believe the sangria was a hit; the margaritas less so. I thought it tasted far more of orange juice than mango; also, the glasses were constantly leaking, with either melting ice, overfilled contents, or ... some part of the margarita? We couldn't figure it out, but did end up using a lot of napkins to sop up the spillage.

Nachos rancheros, with black beans and chicken, was a tasty starter and totally whetted our appetites. The free chips and salsa (mild, verde, and spicy) were also good. Everyone enjoyed their entrees:

Pollo en crema
Cancun platter
Small combo- with enchilada
Chicken quesadilla (grilled chicken, with black beans); my go-to order and idea of heaven

My husband and I had some leftovers, which we greedily gobbled down after returning home. Given that it was a chilly, drizzly, dark Sunday ... the cheesy comforting meal at Celia's (although the Seahawks crushed the Niners' playoff hopes), the laid back time with friends, the friendly service, and the lovely leftovers at home- all this combined to a very happy way to spend a Sunday.
author: S R.

description: Great new find!! Came across this place on our way back from Bay to Breakers. We sat at the bar, which is small and intimate with a very impressive tequila selection. The service is outstanding, our bartender Aidan was so friendly and personable. I don't find myself in this part of SF very often, but it's worth a special trip, will definitely be back.
author: Andrea M.

description:
Came here on Wednesday around 8pm and were seated promptly because the place was 75% empty, but still it took almost 45 minutes for our food order to come out of the kitchen and the food was lukewarm at best. We didn't even get our drinks until we had been sitting for 30 mins! We were dumb for waiting so long but we kept hoping our food would arrive soon. Luckily the busboys brought over basket after basket of chips and bowls of salsa to keep us from revolting during the long wait. I ordered from the pick 2 menu and got a chicken enchilada and a chile relleno with shredded beef inside. Both barely had any meat inside and were smothered in cheese and red sauce. My husband got the mole enchiladas and they were surprisingly dry despite the fact that they were drowning in mole. All of it was double the price of other Mexican restaurants in the city with half the quality and half the amount of meat. 

Tldr; this place is probably only worth it if you come for the $1 tacos in Tuesdays and even then it's questionable.
author: J. O.

description:
Celia's is great! Thankfully. Before the overhaul, the food was inedible. And I'll eat almost anything. That has changed. 

I ordered the carnitas, which I do make at home, so I'm pretty picky about restaurant carnitas. They were good if a little bland - succulent, tender, fresh tasting, and the serving was so generous that we had it for dinner the next night - 2 of us!

My dining companion wolfed down his chicken tacos and said they were good and the coleslaw was stellar. 

We both had organic margaritas and with the fresh juices and organic tequila they were sublime.

Food seemed to take overly long to get to us, and in my seat I had a view of some garbage cans near the kitchen. It also smelled kinda funky and the booth seating isn't too comfortable. Normally I guess I'd be knocking off stars for these transgressions but I'm so happy to have decent Mexican in the Outer Sunset we're overlooking the negatives.
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
I knew I was going to like Celia's right away because the servers greeted me like we were old friends. They also dealt with my picky substitutions on the Expresso Burrito like we were friends, as they didn't even bat an eye. Our server kindly read the order back to me to confirm and was as sweet as ever.

That burrito, by the way, is goddamn delicious. Fresh ingredients. Great sauce. Perfect ratio. Huge. Just fantastic. And I've ordered it since and it is consistently delicious. Even heats up nicely for leftovers.

Two friends and I returned for their pitchers of margaritas, which are very strong. I felt like Celia's, my friends and I became a lot closer that night.

Friendly service, great burritos and good times. Do it.
author: Sam D.

description: This is my spot! I live right around the corner so it's convenient for one. The service is great, food is good, drinks and specials are good. It's a good family restaurant and they love kids. There's plenty of space so they can play a bit. There are projector screens and tvs for sports. Taco Tuesdays and Sunday Brunch are good, especially during football season. Great casual Mexican joint by the beach. Go for it...if you're disappointed, take your butt next door to Beach Burrito.
author: Hashim J.

description: If you're looking for a great Cali burrito and margarita literally by the ocean, this is your place. The service is so amazing, the atmosphere is amazing, everything is amazing:)
author: Roxi P.

description: Excellent service, food is veeeery good (if you order a California burrito, you will be hooked for life lol).  Beware of the Margaritas, they're a creeper.
author: Johnnie W.

description: Great service. Kid friendly. Really bad food. Kids burrito looked like someone opened a can of redried beans, smeared them in a tortilla and microwaved. Those were the only ingredients. Adult burrito giant but bland. Adult fajita just didn't taste good. Would have preferred booths without giant tears on the seats. Margaritas were so so. Came to $45 for all those items given margaritas were discounted.
author: Rainforest C.

description: Yummy food and strong margaritas! Service is always very good. Parking is usually a challenge.
author: Amy L.

description:
I wasn't a fan of this place.
I think the food is bland and not that great. Only good thing they offer is unlimited chips and salsa. Service was decent, but nothing great either.
There are plenty of better Mexican restaurants in the city, i wouldn't recommend this place.

FYI - we tried using the yelp "free guac" check-in special, but they didn't accept it. they claimed that the deal is for a smaller guac than comes as an appetizer, though the appetizer quantity was very very small.
author: Ayall S.

description:
