Solid neighborhood restaurant, great for kids, reasonably priced and decent reliable food. 
Taco Tuesdays, Warriors and Giants on the big screen and kids also eat free on Wednesdays so that is a fantastic option. Love the combo plates.
author: Trim W.

description:
First and foremost this was the worse interpretation of Mexican food I have ever had.  It is bastardized for Anglo tastes and has not resemblance to any authentic Mexican cuisine.  I know Mexican food because I happen to be a second-generation Mexican-American born in the USA.  About the only thing that is Mexican here is the name - Celia's.

Let's start with the over sweet Margarita.  What a waste of Tequila.  The salsa was right out of a jar with a hefty dose of salt to help to improve the taste.  

I ordered the Chile Relleno and enchilada combo.  I make Chile Rellenos at home and make enough to freeze as it is a time consuming dish to prepare so why not make enough to freeze for another day.  What I got at Celia's was basically a cooked egg patty, like an omelet, wrapped around a green chile.  I was shocked.  Picture the egg omelet you get at Subway in the breakfast sandwich.  This is certainly not a Chile Relleno in any region of Mexico.  Disgusting!

The enchilada sauce was canned green sauce.  I found this odd as it is customary to get red enchilada sauce unless you happen to be in New Mexico where they ask - Red or Green. It was all too salty.

The whole Pinto beans were okay.  After all how can you screw up whole beans?  The rice was passable.

The service was not there.  While the waitress was pleasant the overall service was nothing to feel a standard 20% tip was in order.  

I can't say I would ever return to this place to eat.  It's a shame to see what the family Matriarch built with pride for her family to leave to the descendants is reduced to a shadow of what the service and food here used to be like when I firs had it several decades ago.

¡Que lastima que la comida aquí no vale un comino!
author: Catania G.

description: This is not Mexican food!  My apologies to those who eat here and think this is real mexican food. Ordered the burrito plate with rice and beans; and get this, they added cold slaw! No real traditional mexican food has cold slaw featured on a dish. Not only that, but they also added enchilada sauce on top of the burrito. Yes, enchilada sauce covered on top of the burrito. Another big mistake. How does this place get so many great reviews? Eat at your own risk; I repeat, eat at your own risk. Don't expect much from this run down place. Tables and chairs are from the 80's.
author: Mario P.

description:
I love eating dinner near my house because I can walk rather than drive plus you can drink a bit at home then eat out. :)

I was craving for Mexican and didnt want to drive to Mission or Underdogs. I went on my trusty Yelp app and found out Celica's reopened??! What?! I went to the daly city location and thought it was okay. My hubby and I walked and decided to check Celica's out and boy was I glad!

Great customer service

Why is Outerlands always so busy? Is it even that good? 

Nice decor, clean bathrooms and seating

Our waitress Natalie was super sweet. The other waiters were attentive especially with the chips

Celica's reminds me of Tommy's but newer.

Food = excellent

I got the steak plate. Steak was kinda medium even though I requested medium rare. Still flavorful

Hubby got the combination plate. So good especially the carnitas burrito.

Got a margarita pitcher = $23. Really strong. I wish they offer skinny margarita or fresh like Tommy's (lime, tequila an splash of triple sec). Yes I know my margaritas

Overall, the remodeled/reopening was a success. Definitely coming back here again.

Thanks for a great date night and I got to walk home buzzed :)
author: Carol Y.

description:
I was excited to hear that a new mexican resturaunt was going to open up in my hood. And so excited it wasnt another Chevy's (although, got to admit they have the best chips and salsa around!). 

We were seated right away and the ambiance is just like the one in Daly City (I ate there eons ago). We were given chips and two types of salsa right away. The chips were stale? and the salsa tasted like it came out of a can (bummer). We got free guac with our check in but it tasted like it was pre-packaged and it was super watery. 

We ordered nachos and two types of burritos. The nachos were ok. Lots of cheese, some guac, and good scoop of chicken meat. The california and the fajita burritos were next. The california had some flavor to it with a salsa that had a kick. The meat, carne asada, had some good flavor to it. My burrito was tasteless and super dry. Although the carne asada was the same there was no flavor and no kick in this wrap. 

The service was good. We were never without refills. 

But sad to say that this place has a lot of improvements on the food front before I come again.
author: Michelle I.

description: I honestly don't know why everyone complains about the service here so much. My girlfriend and I have been here about 10 times or so now and while at some times it may take a few minutes longer than an average restaurant to get seated or served, the staff is always friendly to us. I haven't tried the tacos as I see many people complaining about but I always get the California burrito and my partner gets the fajitas and both dishes are amazing. I'd like to say I've been to my fair share of Mexican restaurants and this is definitely not a bad one. Margaritas are expensive here but that's okay. The salsa is delicious and I like the atmosphere overall. We both love this place and it's our favorite restaurant to go to.
author: Sean S.

description: This place is balls. Came here after Outside Lands for a bit and som warmth and was met only with the coldness of their staff. No one offered to seat us not ever gave us menus. If you want to be ignored, then this is your spot.
author: Cate H.

description: We come here often as its nearby. Service can be hit & miss - as can the food tbh - but the margaritas are really good & there's always a good atmosphere. If you're fine with average Mexican food, eaten in a vaguely alcoholic haze, then I reckon you'll have a good time here!
author: Fi M.

description: The only thing that is good here is their tostada salad. Everything else tastes like very cheap  Mexican food, very much like Chevy's but worse flavor. Also overpriced.
author: Amelia E.

description:
MMMMMMMM...... 

That's all I have to say about this place!!!!

This was some delicious Mexican food!

Chips with guacamole and salsa were so fresh. (Had like 2 refills)
The unique burritos they have at this place are so yummy, I can't even begin to explain the taste of how delicious they were.

The portions are huge!!! I mean like so big that they could feed two people easily. The burrito that I ordered was so big that after I got through half of it I needed to take the other half home because it just felt like I was consuming 6 burritos at once.

The prices for the portions are perfect as well. Your paying for something you won't regret!

Definately worth trying! Will come back here in the near future!
author: Julia K.

description:
Terrible, terrible food. In no way is it authentic Mexican food. Seems the place is under poor management because the servers were constantly joking around with each other and not paying attention to guests. 

If you are thinking they put more effort in to there drinks because they're food is so bad, think again. The margaritas are over-priced and cheaply flavored. Gross!
author: Eric S.

description:
Full disclosure: my family has been going here for years, so it is nostalgic for me. That said here are the things I like about Celia's:
1. Excellent service. Our waitress Karla M. was so on top of it, she was polite and quick and brought us house-made green salsa to try. 
2. Margaritas in cactus glasses, my date had a coconut blended, YUM. 
3. The restaurant is clean and they project the sports onto one wall in the restaurant so you can watch, if you like. 
4. The food is not gourmet but is consistent with a place that serves drinks in cactus glasses and I felt satisfied an happy when I left.
author: Michelle R.

description:
You had me at $4 margarita in a cactus glass. 

Yes!! Yet again, I am amazed by the gems that encrust the Outer Sunset. I want to wave a sunset-colored flag. I want to write an anthem about fog, Ocean Beach, quiet streets, sushi, and include my latest discovery, Celia's. It's strange to call it a discovery, because Celia's has been there forever, and it's strange and unusual that it took me so long to get myself over there. 

I can rave about the environment. From the outside it's just like the rest of the Outer Sunset -- quiet, humble, and quaint. The inside, however, is colorful, warm, and surprisingly full of energy. 

I can praise the staff. Very friendly, happy, and casual yet professional. Never fear, your tacos and margaritas will make it to your table post haste. 

The food was a delicious and satisfying spread that can double as the necessary medicine after a long day. Hot, savory, tasty, and lovely quality. The Taco Tuesday specials are where it's at. $4 house margaritas, a selection of other equally cheap drinks that I'll have to try next time, and $1 tacos ranging from your traditional chicken + pico, to your interesting pork + mango salsa. My Taco Tuesday partner in crime also ordered the beef fajitas. It came out in full force: sizzling pan of beef, peppers, and onions, coupled with a plate of rice, pinto beans, guacamole and sour cream, and completed with a container of warm tortillas. Ask for more and they'll happily replenish those toasty circles of love. Tip: check in on Yelp for a free side of guacamole. It's nature's cream cheese, and Celia makes it oh so creamy and delicious. 

The house margarita (a sexy $4 on Tuesdays until 9pm) was dangerously good. This ain't no Chevy's "skimp on the good stuff" margarita. That thang was strong -- in the best way possible. Get it on the rocks with salt, they pop a slice of lime in there and complete the beautiful package with a cactus glass. I had four. I had four. I had four. FOUR. Tuesdays will never be the same. 

Overall, it's a comfortable yet lively place with a lovely air of generosity and care about it. The food is darn tasty, and it's a shoe-in on your list entitled "Reasons Why the Outer Sunset can Beat up Your District."
author: Chelsea B.

description:
We recently ended up here after Outerland had an hour long wait for dinner. Celia's by the Beach is just a typical California Mexican restaurant. I ended up getting a combination plate with two shredded beef tacos. I do not recommend getting the shredded beef as it is super greasy. I will never repeat this advice again in my lifetime but I would recommend the ground beef in lieu of the shredded beef.

Blasphemy!

Just trust me. Other than that, the service was decent and everything got to our table fairly quickly.
author: Tara H.

description: So coming into Celias is worth every minute. The bar stays busy but nice. Check into yelp and you receive a giacamole appetizer. The food is bomb and taco tues is amazing! Sports season is amazing because if the S.f. Giants hit a homerun they pour you a free shot. Cant beat that.  I came in on a tuesday and arrived 20 early before opening and they let me in. Most places are hard asses but not Celias. Every bartender is polite , nice, informative, and courteous. Gotta thank my wife who always love to come here. Food is dope and the drinks are #bomb. Thanks Celias for being consistent.
author: El-Khalid M.

description: Neighborhood dining at its best...consistently good food, special orders done correctly and with a smile, wonderful, friendly, attentive service, I love this place. Karla is super adorable and the best waiter I've encountered in quite some time. I highly recommend the Perfecto margarita on the rocks. Ay carumba!!!
author: Monica W.

description:
Came on a Wednesday "family night". Great service , friendly staff , good classic food, cool deco.

Kid friendly is a rarity these days


"I'll be back"
author: James B.

description:
We had a large party so we figured there would be a wait for a table for Taco Tuesday. No problem. We waited about 40 min.....Margaritas were great but an hour after we ordered we still had not gotten our tacos and other
items. When the food finally came, everything was COLD.....not even luke warm. Cold like cold. The waitress who was super busy, asked did we want it reheated. Yes. That would be good. Same platter came back and my friend proceeded to bite into a now luke warm heated up taco, only to bite into something hard. The size of a marble. We concluded it appeared to be something similar to dog kibble. We asked for the manager who tried to convince us it was a piece of avocado pit. Hmmm.  No... I am pretty familiar with avocado pits, that is not one and we're not stupid. More of a deliberate hoax by the kitchen. He took the tacos off the bill but we are now 2 1/2 in and the service, the food and the attitude were a disgrace. Don't have Taco Tuesday if you can't handle the crowd or make decent tacos. It is not rocket science. TBH the large crowds are young people who are there for the margaritas and just need something to soak it up with. They are not there to eat gourmet Mexican cuisine. Too bad, back when their grandfather owned it, in the 70's and 80's, it was authentic Mexican cuisine served with every effort to please the customer.
author: Maria S.

description:
I'm always looking for a good authentic Mexican restaurant... After reading reviews I was excited to try!
Disappointed.. Not authentic... Very Americanized. I can say I wouldn't come here again and the good was just ok. Free guacamole was nice with check in but had no flavor.
author: Angie G.

description: Really liked this authentic joint. Environment is friendly and the ambience is cool. The California burritos are fantastic! We also enjoyed the fajita burritos. Overall very positive experience although wait time was long. Definitely recommend it.
author: Abu Z.

description:
Disclosure: Margaritas were 5 star.
Our server and unnecessary charges were two. We were a table of 4, who walked in at 6 on a rainy Wednesday. Our young waitress was either the dingy-est chick or has been smoking a mellowing substance the entire day. Drinks took forever (15 minutes to wait for a drink & having to remind her (in an empty restaurant): no bueno. Food was gringo-fied but ok.  The icing on the 2 star cake: we got our credit cards billed 3 times for 3 different amounts. One charge was immediately reversed but the 2nd one took days and required me to contact my bank and file paperwork. Also, left message for owner and never got a call back. He did call my friend who complained, though, and her charges were reversed a day before mine.
author: stephany m.

description: This place is great - margaritas every weekend. The servers and bartenders are social and incredibly sweet. They make everything according to your taste, and offer a great atmosphere. Brian acted as our bartender and made our day! If you've got this guy making your drinks, open your mouth and socialize! Brian brings life and perspective to his conversation - surely not to be missed!
author: Angela D.

description:
3.5 Stars!

I have passed this place numerous times (my friend lived right in the area) and pondered about what it looks like inside.

It's small, colorful. I LIKE IT!

Pros:
Attentive waitress, easy to talk to if I had a quick question to ask.
Was able to accommodate 11 people.
It was a band directly in the middle (you're forced to yell at friends) and they played 'LA BAMBA'
No really, they... played La Bamba, though...
The refried beans, coleslaw and rice was delish!
Strawberry margarita was also delish!

Cons:
The fish tacos weren't great.
I had to use a lime to make it fishy. The fish itself were the grilled kind. They were chunky cut fishes and it was hard to eat.

My friend ordered fajitas and it smelled SO GOOD. So, I think there are plenty of options for you to try but that's if you mind trying it over and over...


I would go back for drinks with my friends, even though I dug the service, the food wasn't spectacular. Am I out of pocket for having low expectations of GOOD MEXICAN food in the Sunset?
author: Sweets N.

description: My boyfriend and I grabbed dinner here on a Sunday night; I got a shrimp burrito and my boyfriend got a taco salad. I asked to remove the beans and add sour cream, and ended up with a straight up bean burrito with no rice and no sour cream. After telling our server about the mistake she quickly returned it and came back with an apology and a new burrito. Lo and behold, there was still no sour cream. The server apologized again but laughed it off which I interpreted as rude and poor behavior. Overall, neither of our dishes were that great but I'm more disappointed in the way in which they handled not only one but two mistakes in my order. You would think that after one mishap in someone's order, you'd really make sure that the corrected order was... correct?! I won't be returning.
author: Jamie B.

description: Hanging out at the beach all day?  Want excellent food?!  Stop by Celia's! I haven't had good Mexican food since I've moved to Sacramento. I didn't want to leave San Francisco  with out pleasing my craving. They had an amazing atmosphere! Food was delicious!! Service was amazing! They replenished our drinks and chips before we had to ask!!  They are my go to place when I am town!!
author: Raquel V.

description:
UNLIMITED CHIPS AND SALSA. Yum.

We live a couple of blocks away from the restaurant and don't have to worry about the parking solution. The restaurant is pretty big and there isn't really a wait. There is a bar with seating and a couple of small tables in the front. The large tables extend to the back a bit. The service is awesome. The refill your drinks and chips constantly and are very attentive on how you're doing or if you need anything. As for the food, we usually get the traditional plates, the expresso burrito, and the sample appetizer plate. The traditional plates are awesome. We usually get 2 enchiladas with beans and rice, no coleslaw. We aren't a fan of the tacos or tostadas that they have here. The expresso burrito is HUGE and the picadillo is nice and tender. the sample appetizer plate is fun to share and has different textures and tastes to satisfy your cravings.
author: Vivian L.

description:
Chips & Salsa: superb. (Free Yelp) guac: pretty good.
Ordered a combo meat quesadilla. Very clean...without overpowering globbed cheese....yum. 

ok, ok, and....their Ultimate Marg w Silver Patron was delish as well.
author: Ciao A.

description:
Great service and margs! What more do you want?

Simple mexican that you expect at a spot like this. Sometimes all I want is a greasy enchilada and rice and beans - and that's when I'll come here.
author: Francesca F.

description: Tortilla soup is so good.  Burrito and tacos are pretty good too.  The staff is super nice too.  Great place for a low stress night out.
author: T. E.

description:
I loved the new Celia's. It's impossible to find decent mezzican in the sunset. We drove by the other night and noticed it was open so we decided to give it a go after seeing some favorable reviews. We were pleasantly surprised at how great our meal was. 

No, it isn't taqueria style food. But that's why we like it. Sometimes you're in the mood for mission style mexican and sometimes you're in the mood for restaurant style. 

The chips were fresh and the salsa was tasty. Guac could've used a little more lime juice (I like my guac tangy) but it was yummy too. Service was great as well! I also like the newly painted light blue bar area too. 

Better than El Torito and Chevy's.  And this is The original Celia's. Very cool.
author: Joanne D.

description: I live in Southern California and have been to Mexico hundreds of times so I have a unique perspective when it comes to the Mexican Cuisine.  I was in San Francisco recently and went to Celia's.  I went on a Tuesday and it definitely was the place to be.  I enjoyed the restaurant so much, that I returned on Wednesday.  Fantastic, authentic Mexican atmosphere.  Genuine, sincere staff.  Family recipes passed down throughout the generations.  Definitely a unique experience that I hope others will go experience as well.
author: Jason R.

description:
In some ways this place is perfect for what it is: Americanized Mexican food, & lots of it. And the margaritas are pretty good. I like more authentic, & healthier, food better, but to each his own. The servers are very friendly. It's a great place to take kids. They have high chairs, booster seats, coloring sets and special menus for kids. It's a great place to watch a ball game - either in the restaurant or bar. They have multiple TVs. It's more expensive than a good burrito place, but the prices aren't too outrageous for San Francisco. 

Final thoughts: Tacky, good-natured, & fun for the family.
author: Audrey W.

description:
Living in the sunset it's hard to come across good Mexican but I ate here last night and wow, it must have been the fastest service I have ever received in all my years of eating. 
Live music playing by a guy on a stool.
The waitress was friendly and I asked her what her favorite dish was. She prepped my by saying it was extremely spicy and suggested a side of sour cream to cool down my chops. Shrimp Diablo was super good. It truly was a spicy dish but she was right, the side of sour cream was just the thing to cool down my palate. 

Not bad margaritas and chips.  Recommend this place for authentic Mexican especially if your in a hurry.
author: Jessica M.

description:
We started with crispy hot tortilla chips with a smoky salsa.

The small combo plate is juuuust right. Not to big and not too little.
author: Jacquee P.

description:
Meh. 2.5 stars

Came during the week since I was in the area. I've been to Celia's years ago but thought I'd give it another go since I heard the management/ ownership changed or something.  

Vibe was lively with people at the bar and various tables.  We were immediately seated and chips & salsa were brought out.  Chips were the thin kind and salsa was ok but no heat whatsoever. 
For my main  I settled for two enchiladas and my gf got two chimichangas. They are served with the standard rice and beans.  I thought my enchiladas were just ok nothing special. The chicken enchilada had a ton of shredded chicken stuffed in it but it was a tad dry and not really any flavor to the meat.  Granted I ate my whole plate (I was hungry) the food was just alright.  My gf thought her food was ok too. Nothing outstanding, nothing bad.  Celia's rides somewhere in the middle.  Don't think I'll be coming back anytime soon, there's lots of restaurants to explore in the outer sunset.
author: Julie F.

description: Great place to grab some margaritas and mexican food. The staff is amazing. The environment and eating experience is awesome.
author: Reasonably H.

description:
Best mexican in San Francisco. I spend a good amount of my time in Fresno where there are several of the BEST SECRET mexican food restaurants in the world. That being said, I'm picky. it has taken my 10 years living in SF to find a close equivalent and here it is. Celia's by the beach. love love. 

two cheese enchiladas w rice n beans.
author: Megan M.

description:
This place is terrible.  Food is marginal.  Bar is fun to sit in, so I am giving 2 stars.   The only reason this place survives is there is no competition in the area.  Otherwise, it would be gone, and fast.  

Sad, becuase the location and interrior have plenty of potential.
author: Johnny C.

description: My friend and I were here the night of the NBA finals thinking that it would be a quiet place away from all the ruckus but boy were we wrong haha. Despite the loudness and the seldom rude drunk stranger, we had a great time. Our food arroces very quickly and our bartender, unfortunately I didn't catch his name, is the reason why I'm giving this review. Even though he was extremely busy this night, he still managed to be very attentive and kind, seriously one of the best customer service experiences I have had from a crazy night as this. I hope they recognize this young man for his efforts and hard work!
author: Madelinn G.

description: Ordered Espresso Burrito w/carnitas. MEH. Flavorless in every way. Service was OK but felt rushed to get out. Not asked if I wanted a 2nd beer. Not asked if I wanted dessert. We did want more beer & more food, oh well. I did like the salsa & chips though. Place also needs a good cleaning & a facelift.
author: Secret S.

description: Good food, we enjoyed it greatly...Little pricey but hey it is what it is...we will be back for sure..
author: J W.

description: I can't get enough of the taco tuesday prices! It's always packed with people having a good time. The tacos, chips & salsa, and booze are cheap and delicious.
author: Jamie T.

description:
Went there around opening. They opened a few minutes early.

It was my first time there and I didn't want to stay so I tried to place an order to go. I know that they hadn't officially opened yet, but no one even acknowledged my existence for a good 5 minutes. I had to ask someone if I could place a order, not so amazing.

People where coming in as soon as they opened and most headed to the bar area so I assume their happy hour is good. I got the Veggie Fajita Quesadilla to go and the food was prepared promptly. I wouldn't say it was worth the money though. I didn't like the salsa and but the quesadilla was decent, once again.. Not worth $12. 

Id go back for the happy hour maybe.
author: Raj K.

description: Great neighborhood place. Classic Mexican and unpretentious atmosphere. Food is very good and the service is efficient and friendly. We've been going for years and love that is old-school San Francisco.
author: Wes W.

description:
Meh.  Expensive, mediocre, Mexican.

Weak margaritas, basic menu lacking flavor. The restaurants smells like a dank basement.

2 stars for the service which was good.

Go to underdogs or EBX instead.
author: J. M.

description:
My husband and I go to Celia's quite often, we enjoy their food, but we had noticed a few different times that their management sucks.
 There had been numerous times when we arrived and  they make us wait for about 20 to 30 minutes to have a table even when they have more than 2 or 3 tables available ! One time we asked them about this and they told us they do that to give time to the kitchen to catch up!
Last night it happened again, we were waiting for a table even when they had 4 tables available!  my husband asked a waitress if they could give us a table so we could have drinks instead of been standing by at the  hall, even if we have to wait for food, the waitress went to talk to a manager but nothing happen, they keep us waiting. This doesn't make sense, to have people waiting when they have tables available!
They either should hire more kitchen help or allow customers to seat even if they alert them they will have to wait for their food a bit, don't they realize they could provide better service and make more money (in drinks) if they manage better this place?
author: Araceli L.

description: This place is just ok. Very bland flavorless, american style, Mexican food. Mostly you should come here if you're planning to have some drinks with friends. It's a load neighborhood spot with mediocre service.
author: Morgan B.

description:
Love this place for Taco Tuesday!

My sister and I decided to try this place since we're in the neighborhood and thank god we did because it's pretty legit!

The place was pretty busy but luckily we grabbed a seat at the bar section. The waitress brought us three different salsas (complimentary) and our favorite was the spicy salsa which was spicyyyy and oh so good. After looking at the menu, we ordered the 3 tacos (chicken, pork, and carne asada), which was yummy but mini (however, it was the happy hour menu). Also, we ordered the Coconut Margarita -- amazing!!! and the Mexican hand stand which was strong but good. We decided to try the ceviche since we're on a ceviche crazed..and it was meh. The shrimp/fish in the ceviche was dried and the taste was flavorless. Will pass on the ceviche next time.

Overall, will definitely come here again! high recommend if you're looking for something to do on Tuesday!
author: Julia K.

description:
Their salsa was super tasty!
I grew up on Mexican food and need to have it from time to time.
Living in the sunset, there are not so many choices for yummy enchiladas.
Celia's has dinners cooked the way I remember as I child.
Also, their guacamole is super good! the best in the Sunset.  The real deal not messed up with salsa swirled around it. The chips are nice too:) Not greasy or stale like many you are given.  What a nice experience:)  Thanks Celia's!
author: Lin B.

description: The food at Celias is very good. The atmosphere is great, it looks like a Hispanic hacienda! Depending on how busy it is it can get a little long to get the food out but the wait is definitely worth it. They also offer pick-up/to-go option which is great instead of waiting for a table at peak hours!
author: Romain D.

description:
My girlfriend and I went here Friday night around 8:30/9 and by no means was it crowded. They easily had a full staff and somehow it was impossible to get served. Oddly enough, our waitress asked us what we wanted to order before she ever gave us a menu! 10/15 minutes later we finally got menus and who know how much later they took our orders. I had to find the server in an empty restaurant to ask for more chips and salsa and normally we could careless but we felt like we were being ignored. It was comical to the point where we watched a server sit down, have a margarita while we were trying to get chips. Granted, she might have just finished her shift but after we asked for guacamole three times she was the one to serve us. 

Whatever, no big deal - service was shit and we caught the staff at a bad time but we didn't care we were there to drink so we ordered what I thought was a mid-range pitcher of margaritas - 38.00 dollars, in the Sunset (no one gave us a menu so we had no idea)... but there was a ton of tequila in it. The single reason why I gave this place two stars was because there is a bus boy who works there (hopefully you read this) who was cool as shit! He told me to check-in on a yelp review to catch a cool discount on guacamole.

We didn't eat the food, the drinks were overpriced but filled with a ton of booze and the service was brutal.
author: Sean D.

description: Thus will be my new goto taco tuesday spot! I always loved their house margaritas, my favorite is strawberry blended. Tacos were good. My favs, pork mango and the hard shell shredded beef tacos. The $1 chicken tacos were good but barely any meat, that's why it's a dollar! Chips and salsa yummy too. Good service too.
author: Karen T.

description:
Nachos with carne asada
Chicken quesadilla with extra guacamole
Strawberry Margarita

Yummy Mexican comfort food. Generous portions. Perfectly loud enough to accommodate a toddler. 

A good spot for a good family neighborhood meal.
author: Denise M.

description: I was nervous to try this place, mostly because you never know what you're gonna get at a new Mex restaurant.  Turns out they rock in multiple critical categories: margaritas: rad; salsa: amazing; general food: fantastic; service: friendly and hospitable.  I am of course rating this against classic, sit-down Mex style restaurants (vs a Mission taqueria for example). The only thing I would change is the general layout of the restaurant.  I did a mental re-design of the space in my head as I sat at the bar, cramped, wondering why it was so small when there is more space to take advantage of, the random placement of the tables, the sparse and strange decor.  Come on, people throw a little coin into the joint and make this place sparkle!
author: e w.

description: Great food, service and margaritas! There is always a wait but worth waiting for. My favorites are the chicken mole plate and the chicken tortilla soup! All portions are big so come on an empty stomach or be prepared to take food home. I give Celia's a
author: Elizabeth P.

description:
Yum! It's been a year since I've been in San Francisco and this spot was a welcome treat. 

The meal started out right with chips and salsa. We were also able to use Yelp to get a free guacamole, which was delicious. I got a traditional combo meal with enchiladas, rice and beans, and coleslaw, something I've never seen before at a Mexican restaurant, but it worked out pretty well. The food was really good - definitely better than your average Americanized Mexican restaurant. 

We happened to come on a night when they were offering pitchers of margaritas for $19, so of course we indulged. The pitcher came out bigger than we were expecting, and the margaritas were tasty - win!

The service was fast and nice - everything you could hope for when dining out. The chef even switched out corn tortillas with flour for my friend.

Fortunately, this place is 5 minutes from where I live. I'll be back =)
author: Caitlin W.

description: Fajita meat was thick and not tender.  Large chunks of meat and chicken made making fajitas difficulty.  Service was fairly slow.  Prob won't go back again.
author: Dan V.

description:
We found a favorite local mexican restaurant! woohoo! 

My bf and I came here on a Friday night. The service was great and the food was excellent! Free chips and salsa and you don't even need to ask them for it. Once they see that you're done, they bring you a new one right away. Very smart to do since the food takes quite a while but at least you know the food is fresh and they're busy.

I ordered a mango blended margarita. It was gooood!

Cancun platter was amazing!! I never eat beans but i think their beans. I never eat coleslaw but I kind of like their coleslaw! 

Their portions are huge!! We're definitely coming here again and most likely sharing a cancun platter and margaritas. :)
author: Linda L.

description: Having just watched a beautiful sunset on Ocean Beach, we were in the mood for drinks and a bite.   We walked down Judah and there were a few options along the way, but you had to pick between a drink (Pittsburgh's Pub) or food (Beachside Cafe), so we kept going a couple more blocks until we found Celia's.  Service was really friendly, although a bit slow because there were so many people coming in.  They quickly served up nachos with regular salsa and came back with a spicier green salsa soon after.  We got free guacamole after checking in to Yelp, and ordered fish tacos with black beans and mexican rice, and the tortilla soup.  We topped it off with bourbon and tequila (they had an extensive list of the latter, and a decent selection of the former).  Overall the food was probably okay, but it hit the spot.  We wouldn't trek across town for it but it was in just the right location and was exactly what we needed.  It also got really packed by about 6 pm, especially around the bar and TVs.
author: Vivian W.

description: I had dinner it was ok, being by myself they said booths were for 2 or more,  not fair. Long wait, nosy bar.
author: Mark B.

description:
We came here for dinner on a Sunday night but got our food to go. It was a little before 6PM but it looked like there were still plenty of space to sit. We ordered our food at the front. The restaurant and the workers there all looked nice and friendly. Next time I want to try eating there.

We all got the Expresso Burrito. My friend likes her wet burrito without cheese and they remembered to make it without cheese. The Expresso Burrito was really good. It was also huge. We all finished our burritos but we were amazed how much food we ate.

Pros:
-Good tasting burrito and it's huge
-Chips came with the burrito
-Can get extra sauce for the Expresso Burrito

Cons:
-A little expensive for a wet burrito (was over $10)
author: Paul U.

description:
Celia's by the Beach, you need some tough-love!

Waited SO long for Celia's to reopen. I've been a few times and the only word I can think of is disappointed. The location in San Mateo near Hwy 92 is great! By the Beach needs to get their act together. People want to come here. The restaurant is beautiful. The history is awesome. The sinks in the restroom are gorgeous. They even have Ms. Pac-Man! The food........I have no idea what is going on. If the beans and rice aren't good, there's a problem. And whatever you do, DO NOT order the crab nachos. Sounds good in theory, but trust me on this one. (What's funny is I initially misspelled crab, spelling it crap. Ha, ha! Oops.) 

I'm not saying I won't go back. I probably will at some point. But I am sticking to cerveza.
author: Gina G.

description: I love this place. Reminds me of So Cal Mexican food, and has some of the best margaritas in town.
author: makenna n.

description: I came here with my boyfriend. He ordered fajitas. 20 to 30 minutes later the server brought him the wrong meal.  He then acted like we were wrong. He didn't return to our table. A different waitress, who was the only person working there I guess, walked by and we asked her for our check twice before getting it. As we left we saw our waiter sitting at the bar having drinks...Overall very bad experience.
author: Tira S.

description:
Service: Excellent. Our server was extremely attentive. My girl and I arrived first and we were waiting for the guys. Our server was very understanding that we wanted to wait until the rest of our party arrived before putting in an order. 

Food: I have to say, I think this location's food tastes better than the DC one. I had my regular (Crab Enchiladas) and it was delish. The DC one doesn't give me guac but this location did. I don't care for guac but it was on my plate =) 

Overall, we had a great time. I'll have to return for happy hour or something.
author: Serena F.

description:
Nothing beats mexican food, sports, and Friday nights....

It's the end of a long week, so I decide to try Celia's by the Beach with one of my good friends.  We arrived at ~7:20 P.M. with a few people waiting to be seated in front of us.  The nice, energetic hostess informed us of an approximately 10 minute wait.  Cool, I'm in.

Twenty minutes later we were seated.  The spread between quoted wait time and actual wait time was not a big deal.  We got a booth in the back of the restaurant where I had a perfect view of the As game--perfect for any sports junkie (unless, of course, you're trying to impress your date).

I got the combination plate that included two enchiladas, rice and beans.  Total: $11.50.  Not bad for a fair amount of food!  The actual meal was good, not great.  The free guacamole for checking in on Yelp was a total plus though.  If I were to rate my whole meal on a scale of 1-10, I would rate it a 7.  It was good enough to be back if I am craving Mexican food, but not so much that I would still be talking about it on Monday.

The bar area seemed to be popular for the men who were blatantly checking out the cute girls at the front.  Ah, people watching can be all sorts of good entertainment.  Overall, a good experience.  I would recommend Celia's if you're in the area.
author: Bryce M.

description:
I've been two times now, both for a Friday happy hour/wind down.  I love Mexican food and could eat tacos and chips and salsa every day.  This place, though?  It just doesn't cut it.  Maybe it's that my newly vegetarian self just isn't vibing with Mexican food in general.  I asked what the vegetarian fajita quesadilla included and was told squash, peppers, cauliflower 'lots of veggies'.  It came with an abudance of onions and a couple of peppers.  No thanks.  Also, the soup was...empty?  Chicken broth and avocados, basically.  Why not make it with vegetable broth instead to cater to vegs?  Chips and salsa is good.  Guac is standard.  Margaritas are probably the only reason I'd come back.  They definitely pack a punch.  

Service is something this place does have going for it, though.  Chips and salsa guy is totally on the mark.  Hostesses were friendly and our waitress was really apologetic about the quesadilla.  So yeah, that's where the 3rd star comes from.
author: Amber E.

description: Love the food and drink came for taco Tuesdays and their taco are good and also their margarita are good.
author: Lala L.

description:
Where to begin...

Celia's has SO MUCH potential. Alas, it is wasted at the new restaurant.

Came in and ordered two margaritas, chips and guac, and two dinners. Order received: dinners, then margs, then chips and guac. It's at about 8pm on a Saturday night, and they were not busy.

The drinks: strong, but they taste like shit. If I wanted tequila, I would've ordered tequila. The flavor was not there - just bad. My girl had the blended mango marg, and while flavorful, it seemed like they just took the booze they'd put in hers and swapped it into mine. It was basically a fruit smoothie.

The food was good. It wasn't drop dead awesome, but it was better than average for this style of casual Mexican restaurant. The dishes were flavorful, the portions were as expected, and the verde enchilada was downright tasty.

The service? Fucking awful. No apologies for the late appetizer (which was sent back  AND they tried to charge me for). No apologies for drinks that came after the meal. After all food was done, a solid 20 minute wait for the check. Most inept manager ever standing around chatting with staff and not fixing anything. Example of ineptitude: Waiting (30 minutes) for drinks, I started to scan the dining room. I was giving the look -- the combination -- hey, I'm frustrated / can you fix this? So dude comes over, I mention our drinks still have not arrived. He assures us they'll be right out. About 5 minutes later (35 minutes in now, let's keep track), our waitress comes to the table TO TAKE OUR ORDERS AGAIN. We hear our waitress PLACE THE ORDER AT THE BAR. Homeboy hadn't done a thing. ANOTHER TEN MINUTES, and the crappy drinks land -- grand total, 45 minutes. Best part? Waitress then says, "Oh, there was a mixup at the bar." No, there wasn't. Watched the whole thing, and basically, you're just kind of shitty at your job.

Wanted so much for this to be good. But as is, I won't be back. $50 for two and this bad? Fool me once, shame on me...
author: Jonathan M.

description:
Sooooo....I LOVE this place the only reason it doesn't get 5/5 is the service and the random closures. I've gone on two different weekend nights after holidays to find they were closed (very inconvenient for the outer sunset).. Also, always sit at the bar if you want fast and efficient service. Aiden, one of the bartenders, is amazing. Great suggestions, good conversation, and attentive. I feel like sometimes the wait staff is a little too laid back beach style. Always friendly, but friendly doesn't always fill my belly and bring me another margarita. I'll always opt for the bar over the comfy booths from now on. Also, never seem to notice a manager. Just a tiny bit too laid back for such a great restaurant. 
FOOD, omg FOOD. It is so flippin good! I always get fajitas and chile rellenos. They are huge portions and the flavor is super on point. Tortillas are amazing and maybe fresh? I'd skip the guac, its flavorless, but definitely go with the spicy salsa. It's smoky and delicious. Carne asada is standard, good, and I'd order it again. Ceviche, I wouldn't get it again, I needed more salt, lime, and spice...too bland for me. Enchiladas are great! I've never had the burritos but they look so so yummy. 
Overall, go there. And go there on a Wednesday when you can get a gigante margarita for %9. Two of those and you're toast!
author: Kayleen R.

description: Really liked this place, and our server we had on National Margarita Day (guy with a beard) was great! Would definitely come back for the pitcher of margarita and yummy food.
author: Tiffany M.

description: Enchiladas in Celia's is my favorite food!! The service is excellent, the hostess is really kind and all the people there make me feel like I'm in Mexico every time I go. All the dishes are delicious! Highly recommended.
author: Francisco T.

description: I live nearby so I always order food and it's always terrible. Super oily, the vegetables often burned. In general, overcooked and mushy. I don't like to criticize without having a good reason, but every time I see the food and how poorly cooked it is... I swear to myself I would never order it again. Guys, you really need to work on that! Hope in place food is better than take-out
author: Leticia R.

description: This is the place to be on taco Tuesday!! Tasty tacos, strong cheap margaritas, and great service! I will definitely be back.
author: Chelsea S.

description: A great place for a really good mexi- meal. Super friendly... and the beach afterwards.
author: J M.

description: Enough has been said here regarding wait time and good food. I order the same thing every time because it is clean, fresh and tasty. Ceviché, cole slaw and guacamole and chips. On a Wednesday night there was a 15 minute wait (I trust the person who said when they were seated she noticed empty tables). I nabbed a table in the bar because service is faster. Bus boys and waitress (ASHLEY!!!!!! Adorable.) were great.  I placed my order and asked that the Ceviché have the additions on the side. She checked. They couldn't.  So I looked at the menu again and noticed on the bottom it said changes and were welcomed. She came over and I pointed that out saying I just couldn't eat the portions that they serve (huge). She went back and checked and yep they could do it. She was terrific, the service and food were as well. Always a go to place.
author: Water L.

description:
So I'm a few visits short of becoming the Mayor on another app, but I do love me some Celia's -- especially on Taco Tuesday. Those mango pork tacos cannot be be beat. 

Welcome back to the Sunset, we're so glad you're still in our neighborhood.
author: Angelina C.

description:
We've been here two times since the "by the Beach" rebranding.

Overall, the service is very good. The staff overall is fairly friendly and attentive.

It's not the greatest Mexican food, but for the Sunset neighborhood I would say that it's certainly the best option for the "sit down" experience. The drinks and cocktails did not disappoint and the food comes out nice and hot.

My main critique is in their plating. There's a lot of white space there... I say either get smaller plates or add more beans and rice to make it look more appealing, because the way it is, the diner may get the feeling they are being gypped.

Great neighborhood spot. You should have a great time if you come in without any pretention.
author: Jeffrey J.

description: My husband, son and I had dinner here. They charge $7.25 for 4-5 little chimichangitas the size of Chinese egg roles. Are you kidding? When that meal came, I thought they brought somebody's else order. My husband ordered a burrito for $14.25 that was medium size comparing to other Mexican places..without sauce on top and sort of dry inside as well. As far as the service, the hostess put us right next to the bathroom in spite of the fact that the restaurant was almost empty. Very disappointed :(
author: Mary E.

description:
I did not know this place was a chain! A long time ago I went to the one in Lafayette because it was my uncles favorite restaurant and my roommate frequents this location and I just never put two and two together!

Anyway, the service is S LO W. We were probably there for over an hour and it wasn't even that busy. 

The food is okay.  I got the enchiladas. It's not stellar but it's not bad, I would definitely eat here again. The salsa they gave with the chips was the best. It was super cold, had a lot of cilantro and was tomatoey! 

I also got a blended strawberry margarita and it was not blended. That is my pet peeve.  The most annoying thing in the world, seriously! There was barely any ice in it and the little ice that was in it was chunky.   

Next time, I think I have to try the burrito with a soda.
author: Marisa R.

description: Taco Tuesday was an interesting experience. The food was delicious and the service was excellent given the fact that their Wi-Fi and credit machines were down. The margaritas were quite refreshing too! I don't know why I haven't been to this place sooner, but I may become a regular on Tuesday afternoons/evenings.
author: Michael G.

description:
Great Place! This was my first time here. The staff was really friendly and helpful. They have a huge selection of food and I can't believe how many beer choices they have! The food was really good and you get a really good amount .

Great spot to hit up before Outside Lands next month!! I definitely recommend this place and will be coming here more often!!
author: Liz S.

description: First time at this location and I will probably never come back. I have been sitting with my family for over and hour and we still did not get our food. We didn't order anything complicated, just the usual tacos and such. They didn't tell us that fish tacos take longer... Longer as in an hour?? Service was good, but really an hour for simple Mexican food?? Drinks were not good either. They need a real bartender. At least the chips and salsa are bottomless.
author: Megan A.

description: I came here planning to order a margarita while waiting for my table at Outerlands. Place smells of urine, I almost threw up. Left as quickly as I came in.
author: Ellen T.

description: Service is alright but super slow. Food is typical white-washed Mexican food but it's still pretty good.
author: Cat M.

description: Decent, but nothing special.  Big portions of food with decent, but unexciting flavor.  Chips and salsa are good and my friends always enjoy a margarita.
author: Kellan M.

description:
My daughter and I had dinner here last week. My 1st time back since the remodel and they did a great job. Celia's is an institution and I love it just for that. As a native I appreciate the places that have weathered the ups and downs of the times. Any place that has been around  since 1960 is doing something right. 
  I agree with the many comments that the salsa could use a bit more zip, but it's fresh...and not from a jar. I had the Mole enchiladas and was very pleased. They put some heat in this sauce, so they do know how to do it.  My daughter is a vegetarian and there were any options for her.
   As we walked out full and satisfied, we had a nice chat with Phil, the husband of the owner. everyone very friendly. A neighborhood place that you will always feel comfortable going into.
author: Michele F.

description:
I'm not sure how I grew up in the Sunset and lived there on and off off for almost 30 years, yet never went to Celias.  It always looked dead on the outside.  I always thought it was an abandoned building.  I never saw anyone go in, come out, or even loiter outside.  They could really use a make-over.

That being said, I'm I so glad I finally figured out that it is a legit Mexican restaurant that has indeed been in business my entire lifetime.

When the chips and salsa are delicious, I tend to have high hopes for the meal.

They have lots of standard stuff like enchiladas, burritos, and chile relleno.  But I like that they serve a lot of things that you don't always find, like enchilladas with mole sauce, fish tacos, and something else I am forgetting now.  I also like how they serve their food with coleslaw instead of iceburg lettuce.  Nice change, and very yummy and healthy.  

My enchilladas verdes was really, really good.  The cheese inside was a lighter cheese--not greasy and heavy like everywhere else I have had cheese enchilladas.  Made it very easy to digest.  The verde sauce was fresh and delicious.  The beans and rice were very tasty as well (and yes you CAN mess up beans & rice).  

The staff was attentive and friendly.  Although a makeover is needed, there is something really pleasant and satisfying about knowing you've walked into a long-time local establishment, instead of the latest trendy restaurant.  

They deserve 4 stars.  Maybe I will change it to 5 after I try it a few more times.  I found it to be just a tad on the pricy side, but it beats going all the way to the Mission, and the food is just as good.
author: Lizzie R.

description: Service was terrible. Took over an hour to get our food and when we ask the waitress how much longer, she said she would check on it. When she did come back she didn't let us know the status of our order. She just started taking orders for the table behind us. When our food did come our, 3 of our orders were wrong. Will not come back here again.
author: Christina S.

description:
been a few months since my husband and i have been to celia's, so after a long hike night last week, we decided to stop In and have a few beers and a quick nosh on their awesome chips & salsa, (homemade salsas are very tasty) & yummy large guac. bar was packed when we got there, so we sat at a bar table and ordered guac & beers around 8:30. We were a little bummed with the service that evening, but normally the service @Celia's is cheerful and friendly! I'll make note to go earlier @happy hour and enjoy the many things we do love about celia's:
great margaritas and tequila selection, guac, chips & salsa, the giants, beers, atmosphere, and friendly staff.
cheers!
author: Mish C.

description: Decent beans and rice, tasty guac. Otherwise, the place was dirty and we were seated by the bathrooms which were stinky.
author: Michellie O.

description: this place is def haunted. a cup of salsa moved from one end of the table to another its own. 10/10. would spook again.
author: nosuch n.

description:
My Girlfriend and I went here last night as we were craving some good Mexican food and some Good Margaritas.
We got much more than that.  We planned on have one margarita each but by the end we had 3 each as we couldn't get enough.  
The food was really great as well. 
LOVED the Chimichanguitas.
Both of our meals were great as well.
We will be back soon and often. Definitely support this family fun restaurant and get some good comfort mexican food!
author: Nick S.

description: It's delicious, but the margaritas are really overpriced, as are many of the entrees. Stick to the combinations on the back of the menu.
author: Colleen M.

description: We were walking down the street, looking for a spot for dinner. I'm so very glad we poked our heads in. The hostess gave us a great run down of the menu, and we decided to try it. All the servers were amazingly friendly and helpful. I didn't feel rushed at all, and our server was very attentive. I had a fish burrito, and my husband the mole. Both were great! I'll definitely be going back. This might be my new Mexican food spot.
author: LT B.

description: I have enjoyed going to Celia's for many years! I love the Nachos Grande, my husband's favorite is the Pollo with Mole sauce, our daughter likes the Carne Asada and especially their cole slaw!! Not to mention the best Margaritas- and virgin strawberry Daiquiri- Their ingredients are always fresh, crisp, tasty. If you ask, you can get three different salsas with your chips. The staff is prompt, friendly and helpful. They have reduced the menu since they re-opened, but everything is good and we love the place. I personally regret they put huge screens everywhere, but I guess there is no escape from those in our world anymore
author: Pascale L.

description: BEST TACO TUESDAY THERE IS! Their coconut margarita is awesome and their guac is amazing
author: Page F.

description:
I have eaten here many times now over the past few years. I keep getting dragged back by my in-laws who like it.  I find the decor old and dirty, the wait staff non-attentive and each and every time I eat here I get sick.

Last time I noticed one of the servers use the bathroom and then NOT WASH HER HANDS! 

Turns out we were the lucky ones she served next.  No wonder I always get sick.  

NEVER AGAIN.
author: Amanda P.

description: I've always enjoyed my meals at the various Celia locations. My go to dish is the beef enchiladas. I love their guacamole and salsa as well. The reason I gave 4 stars is because parking can be difficult to find.
author: Mikaila O.

description: The mole enchiladas are the best I have ever tried. Cabbage side salad goes great with it. Good location close to the beach or after a day at the museum. Oh...and the  margaritas were on point.
author: E. Y. G.

description: Tonight, I made a huge party foul, and came in 5 minutes before closing. (I cringe as I admit this, because I'm a server :/ ) anyway, they were so awesome and sweet about it. I know how annoying it is have those last minute customers. Because of this, I decided that since they were willing to serve us, I didn't care what kind of service we got. I was so surprised at how kind and attentive the staff was, despite how close to closing we had arrived. Another awesome time here at Celia's! Thanks again
author: Enissa M.

description:
The Good: 
Fast service.
The hot salsa actually has some heat to it. 
Dos Veggie Chimichangas is a good vegetarian option.

The Bad: 
The "vegan" beans were topped with cheese.
author: J M.

description: Took over 30 minutes to be served and they expect ed me to pay before I was served.  Bad customer service makes a poor meal even if the food tastes good. I'll not make a habit of eating here.
author: Patrick F.

description: Ordered takeout and the girl over the phone was super helpful and patient with my questions. My enchilada mole & verde was ready in 15-20minutes which was awesome. The nachos and enchilada was yumm-OH! The chicken and shredded beef was juicy and tender.
author: Angela L.

description: Since emailing the manager about this situation, he helped with the problem and I feel like he and his staff took my concerns seriously. Thank you
author: Tom A.

description:
In the mood to try something different from our normal haunts, but still relatively close by, we went to Celia's by the beach. The experience was okay, but not particularly recommendable.

We got a burrito and salad, to order from two ends of the spectrum. The salad was the better of the two dishes, but neither wowed us.

Also, the salsa and chips provided were a little weak, especially the salsa which had no spice to it whats so ever (and no we aren't trying to act hardcore, this would have made mild Pace salsa look like a flamethrower).

Overall, it was decent, but we will stick with Underdogs for our Tex Mex fix.
author: Sami R.

description: Our first meal in San Francisco and it was delicious. I can recommend the expresso burrito and the fajitas at the next table smelled fantastic. Best service we have had in a long time from our waiter Alex and the rest of the staff
author: Beth B.

description:
Love the atmosphere here! We love to walk up there with our 9-month old as it's lively in there and it's ok if she makes a little noise. I would have to say that foodwise, the enchiladas (chicken and carne asada) are my faves. I prefer other burritos in the area, but the enchilada plate is pretty good.  The margaritas are very good here! The staff has always been very nice, and are accommodating to strollers.

Oh yeah - the regular red salsa and fresh chips are awesome while waiting for food!
author: Zac W.

description: Erica. Best. Server. Ever. Also Brian (?) from a previous visit-legit host. Where is that guy? Either way love this place and the people. Its rare to fine both these days in this city. If heaven was a bar, it would be Celia's.
author: Alexandra M.

description: Decent fare, would like it to be spicier but after living in AZ for 10 years, nothing here in SF approaches what I expect. That aside, the service is decent, food is decent, margaritas are decent. For the reasonable prices they charge it is certainly fine.
author: Roberta B.

description: Living in San Diego, I get my fair share of AMAZING authentic mexican food. When it come to the Bay Area, nothing can compete with Celia's by the beach. Enchiladas w/ rice and beans is a go to for me. Huge shot out to the management for the food, and especially the Margaritas. You will not go wrong with anything on the menu here, it's a great place to get some Mexican food!
author: Ian S.

description: I've always been a big fan of Celia's on the Peninsula, and I'm so glad they reopened this one in the Sunset. It's not as big as the others and the menu doesn't have quite as much to choose from, but it's perfect for the location. We sat at the bar while we waited for a table and the bartender was really pleasant and the margaritas were really good. The food is just as good as the other Celia's and the guac is to die for. I left here drunk, stuffed, and happy. Definitely will be back again and again.
author: Kelsey L.

description:
I've gotten tired of the burrito shops, taco trucks and fancier Latin cuisine places that are all over my area. Ventured out to Celias's today and am happy to say its everything I've been missing!  Spanish music, unlimited chips and salsa with one house, one hot, and burn yourself plates! I had the combo chicken enchilada and shredded beef taco plate and it was excellent! I'll be coming back to Celia's for
sure!
author: Emily L.

description: Friendly staff,  great margaritas,  and they're generous with the food. I ordered a large combination plate and it was enough to share
author: Nicole T.

description:
First time at this place, we really like the atmosphere and food, but....

I ordered two margs at the bar, a virgin and a regular. Our bill came (we transferred it to our table) and it had an upcharge on BOTH drinks. We told the waitress they were both mistakes, that we didn't order anything other than a virgin and house marg and that wasn't good enough. She told me I needed to talk to the bartender myself....I then had to go confront the bartender and he took it off, but talk about ruining a good vibe - and also feeling like there is some shadiness going on...
author: Niki H.

description:
The food is yummy. The service is good.

I have food allergies and, so far, I have not had a reaction from eating here. They are honest and clear in answering my questions about ingredients in their dishes and whether or not I should order something based on my limitations.

The organic margarita is very good. The house margarita is not... but it's priced accordingly on Taco Tuesday at least. :)
author: Sarah T.

description: Well, I lost to a girl at Ms. Pac Man. And I was drinking ginger beer when she was on Margarita #2. I hope Outerlands and Celia's know how much of a good thing they have going. When we put our name on the list for the hour wait we knew exactly what to do, and so did three other parties: head in here for a drink or three, chips & salsa, a chipper, good lookin' chap behind the bar who's keeping it real & working hard, and a game of Ms. Pac Man. Tile on the bar. Tile on the floors. Tile on the walls. Mezcal flights. Said Australian ginger beer. Arched passageways. And, an indoor thatch roof. Should've played Gallaga!
author: Jon A.

description:
Celia's is the worst Mexican restaurant I have ever visited. I will list out the reasons why:

1. There were chips crushed all over the floor and seats of the restaurant. It was not intentional because the flooring is carpet. EW!

2. Service was slow and inattentive. The servers were busy flirting with the manager in the back. 

3. Food was luke warm at best and had been microwaved from frzen because I could taste the refrigerator. We tried everything on the "vegetarian menu" and it all tasted like leftovers. The chimichangas were cold on the inside and hot on the outside.

4. Overpriced. After getting through half my meal and not being able to finish, I had to pay over $10 per entree. NOT WORTH IT!

Tip: Don't visit here if you want to taste REAL Mexican food. I should know, I am Mexican.
author: Jaq D.

description: Bottomless mimosas on Sunday's, our server Alex was awesome we never saw the bottom of our glass he made sure to keep refilling our glasses. We had mole enchiladas and the Carne Asada fries everything tasted great. We'll be back next Sunday for sure!
author: Ashlei T.

description: The food is great and also the service I can't see why anyone would give a bad review.  The young generation have it well under control they are so nice and very polite.  My husband and I go there once a week.
author: marie S.

description: Bad Mexican food... I'm so sorry Celia.. Ive tried it 5 or 6 times, and nothing i have ordered was good. In fact, I actually returned my meal once, and I NEVER do that. However, the drinks are great, and I love the new atmosphere. And the service is great too. The problem is only with the food. I life 1 block away and we get take out 3-5 times a week, but we would not get it from them. Please please make the food better!! I love Mexican food and want to be a regular!!!
author: Jenna G.

description: The California burrito was HUGE! and really really good. The waitress was nice and they really...just didn't do anything wrong. The burrito itself gets a 5 star review in my opinion. We got a free thing of Guac because of the yelp offer too and that was pretty good.
author: Gregg H.

description:
This place had it's nasty, crappy years which stopped me from going there for a decade..but w/a recommendation from a friend who did try it a while back, finally mustered up to try for dinner last night. Glad I did, the complimentary chips were good & the very mild salsa was delish, very fresh & not spicy at all so appeals to non spicy palates. I ordered the enchilada & chile relleno combo, everything was spot on. Exactly what I wanted to eat, rice & beans were so good though my chile relleno was not piping hot, lukewarm only--BOOOOO!!!. I also like that they offer small combo plates for light eaters & monsterous combo plates for the big eaters (they have 2 of these monster combos w/almost one of everything!). Prices are reasonable for a sit down mexican restaurant ($13.50 for my enchilada & chile relleno combo). 
My dining friends ordered their burrito but added salsa verde to it (for a wet burrito) but adding salsa verde added an extra $1.50 to their burrito--is this common? charging extra for the green sauce?? It was a very hearty size with guac & salsa on top..looked yummy. 

Waitress was friendly too.

Overall, I will come back to the place. docked star due to the floor where I sat underneath the booth was dirty. House margarita for $7.50 which mainly was ICE? uh, no thanks! Parking is HORRIBLE here (DAMN those 'parklets' at outerlands, taking away precious parking space--stupid!).
I will eat one of those monsterous plates one day because I know i will have leftovers for next day (whoo hoo, 2 meals!

Celia's: pls update your prices on website.
author: Yolanda L.

description: Organic margaritas we're good, albeit $10.50 each. It's weird they don't put the drink prices on the menu. Service and food was mediocre but tolerable.
author: Stephen B.

description: Great for taco tuesdays, otherwise its run of the mill Tex-Mex. Not complaining. Its my comfort food but nothing that really stands out either. I like the cantina but if your eating more than just tacos it might help to get a table.
author: Matt H.

description: I really love Celia's, but recently visited the SF location. The chips were delicious and so was my meal-1 enchilada with rice and beans. The customer service was also excellent. The restaurant itself is older and not as clean as the other locations. We had to move booths BC we were first seated near the restrooms and the smell was potent :/ kind of gross when you are eating. Also, the original margarita is VERY sweet. Instead, order the organic margarita. Much tastier.
author: Kasa R.

description: This is a good place to go if you don't want to venture downtown or the mission. I love their nachos and the combo plates. The salad on the combo plate is good I wonder if it's homemade dressing. The tamal is really moist and the enchiladas are the stars at Celia's. They have free soda refills and I think it would be great to watch a game here.
author: Nadia N.

description: This place is so so rad! Awesome service and awesome food! Bryan, bionica, and Jess are amazing! Great service from them and they are so nice
author: Emily H.

description: Excellent tostada salad, guac, chips, and salsa.
author: Sandra T.

description:
This is the weirdest place I've been for Mexican.  The combo plate is a sea of beans and sauces with little islands of tortilla and a mountain of rice.  I got enchiladas, so ok, fair enough...but the ration of tortilla to sauce to everything else was way off.  

The chicken tacos use a shredded chicken which could have come from a tin.  The tortilla was fried to be crispy a'la Ortega or some such. 

All up, it just felt very off.  Very Tex-Mex.  NOT what I would expect of a California taqueria.  On the plus side?  The horchata was nice.
author: Matt B.

description: I have lived almost my whole life in the Sunset and never gone to Celia's.  Maybe once about 15 years ago but that hardly counts anymore ha ha.  My friends took me here for an early birthday celebration and for taco Tues.  My favorite tacos were the pork and mango ones.  The hard shell beef ones were also good and we didn't get the $1 tacos because my friend said don't bother.  They didn't have hot sauces readily available on the tables which I thought weird.  And when we asked for some they had Tapitio which is OK but a house made one would have been nice.   We also ordered some blended margaritas, mango, strawberry, and pomegranate which were all good.  The best part was the chips and salsa.  Our server was so sweet and attentive even though they appeared to be pretty busy.  5 stars for her!
author: Rosalind S.

description: Had the chili verde, which was good, but I wasn't blown away by it. The sides of rice and refried beans just seem to take up space. Not a fan of the cole slaw. Friendly service!
author: Maximillian M.

description: the service was good and the food was ok....pretty good place i guess if you're in the area but I wouldn't drive that far (again) to eat here. Not the best place for little kids. When I was there a group of buzzed old guys were talking very loudly and cursing and since I've only been here  once i don't know if this is a daily thing or not but I can say the bar is heavily used by most lol.
author: Aakash X.

description:
I have to give Celia's five stars because last night we were "Those People" - a reunion of about 15 friends (20?!) who hadn't seen each other in ten years.  We were a server's nightmare - all margaritas, all different - salt, no salt, on the rocks, blended, not too sweet, this kind of tequila, that kind - all different plates - these beans, those beans, this substitution, that substitution.  Constantly switching seats and pushing the tables around, and then!  SEPARATE CHECKS!  What a nightmare and always met with amazing, unfailing, cheerful, kind, patient, friendly service.  Absolutely unbelievable.  Unbelievable. 
And the food -what's not to love.  In fact, I am going back tonight with the kids to eat my chicken enchiladas in peace.
author: Gabriele K.

description: I like the atmosphere but the fajita burrito was pretty bad... I'm kind of a Mexican food Conosseur and this food was nowhere near my standards. Lol. The people who work here are cool tho and the enchiladas are okay just don't get a burrito, guacamole isn't to hot either. I feel like a bitch but I'm just bein honest!!!
author: Julia ..

description: Unfortunately I do not remember anything memorable during my dinner here with friends, except that they have really good complimentary salsa and chips, yep that's it.      We got a good range of dishes, from my tostada salad (which was like half of melted cheese), to burritos and a few combo plates...again nothing out of the ordinary, but not horrible either.  The guacamole was pretty good, but towards the end, the onion was a bit overwhelming.  The service was slow but friendly and the prices were okay.
author: Nicola V.

description: i love this place i just cant get enough of their crazy burritos and amazing drinks. If you are looking for a good and fun place to eat and drink i highly recommend celia. This place is lieterally like crack.
author: Alex S.

description: I had a tough time rating this place. And yes, I came to the conclusion that I am a fan of Celia's just for the location, happy hour, (especially Tuesdays $1 tacos), and really friendly service! Didn't like the tortilla soup, tho but enjoyed waiting for my laundry to dry and having a place to have a bite, watch some football and have a margarita. They really need a bigger bar tho. Also what is up with the 4pm opening? Don't people want to eat lunch? I should really keep going back tho seeing that it is so close to me and I haven't had much on the menu.
author: Skye J.

description:
I mostly go for Taco Tuesday. $1 soft tacos, $2 hard tacos, $4 margaritas, and a bunch of other deals. 

food is good, but not the greatest. their traditional plates are good if you want a full meal. 

the level of customer service did get a lot better. there used to be a few girls in there who were the worst. glad to see a fresh batch of workers with better attitudes.
author: Peter C.

description: Delicious Fajitas and great ambiance. Very slow service because of the 9ers game that was going on, but totally worth it if you are around.
author: Guillaume B.

description: This was our to go Mexican restaurant when we have guests in town.  The last few times have been a disappointment.  Service is slow.  The waiting is long and they don't seat people although there are a lot of empty tables.  We dropped by 5:25PM for dinner and the hostess said the waiting time will be 45 minutes to 1 hour but we actually waited for 1 hour and 45 minutes.  I wish the hostess had been more upfront about the waiting time.  We would have not waited that long and went to another restaurant instead.  Not going back again!
author: L B.

description: Ok, first I want to say, what margarita isn't "great"? They all are, we don't need to hear it. It's alcohol masked with a sweet drink, how can it not be good? Point is, it can't be. Moving on, their Mexican food is good and the service was GREAT., The wait staff was very knowledgeable about the allergen content of their food and were very good at helping me navigate the menu and avoid gluten and dairy. One of my favorite dishes is the Chili Colorado but I can usually never eat it because it's almost always thickened with flour.... not here A lot of their sauces and dishes are gluten-free, which is great for a lot of people.
author: Johnson M.

description: Awful. The bartender made us wait for the manager to get in bc she didn't know how to check an Oregon id. The carpet is dirty, there are flies in the air, and when we finally received our drinks, they were watery and bland. My friend ordered the quesadilla and it was packed with onions and nothing else. The man who refilled our waters every 10 minutes was very attentive and sweet-- unlike anything else in the place.
author: Alexis B.

description: Great organic margaritas!! The enchiladas verdes and chicken fajitas are bomb. Love this place - friendly staff, big selection of food (and beer!) - exactly what I want in a neighborhood Mexican restaurant.
author: Sarah D.

description: Atmosphere was cool, staff was great, food way A-okay.
author: Jennie B.

description: Yes, I am a bit biased because I was a regular before the restaurant was reincarnated  "by the beach," but what a wonderful resurrection it is! The space is now fresh and bright and airy and the staff is very eager to please. The food and margaritas were delish. They were in the soft opening stage when I visited, so I will update with a full review once the restaurant has settled in. Given the enthusiasm of management and their desire to continue the tradition of  warmly welcoming customers into Celia's familia , I have no doubt they will succeed.
author: Laurie A.

description: Great for a quick date night or a big get-together with friends. Expresso burrito and enchiladas verdes are our favorites.
author: Tara C.

description:
Weird tasting salsas(too much oregano in red and no flavor to green)
Wet burrito - super dry carnitas, dental floss like
Chile relleno - hard cheese inside a very small pepper

Not to mention about a 30 minute wait for that food to be served up...and well I've nothing great to say about service or atmosphere.

Nothing special about this place other than the price being self inflated. 

Won't be back. Won't be singing praises. Too bad.
author: conaill g.

description: So delish! They always provide you with plenty of chips and salsa as soon as you sit down...the salsa is really tasty and not too spicy. I recently went for taco tuesday and tried the mango tacos which were different but super good. Can't wait to go again soon!
author: Kianna H.

description: Big improvement! I haven't been there for years but will definitely go again. The service was excellent. The staff was friendly and attentive. The atmosphere was comfy. I would give the food 3 1/2 stars. The beans were good, rice good, enchilada was good, only the chile relleno could use a little more fluff. Even the salsa and chips were good. My husband says 4 stars for his veggie chimichanga.  The service gets a solid 5 stars.
author: Christy M.

description:
This restaurant is TERRIBLE. The service is very, very slow; wait time for the food is equally slow. 

I ordered the "Crab Nachos" and spent the entire dinner looking for the crab in my nachos, which was nowhere to be found.

The manager seemed sleazy and utterly impervious to the horrible service that occured.

Shut this down asap!!!
author: Kit K.

description: Where the Outer Sunset mafia wines and dines (and then wines some more).
author: Maria D.

description: This is exactly what San Francisco was lacking, and it is located right in my neighborhood!  Good Americanized Mexican food is what I have not been able to find in the city.  Sure you can always get great traditional fare in the Mission, but sometimes I want to be a glutton and go with the stuff I ate as a kid.  The beer selection is eclectic and the Margarita's are worth the trip to the Outside Lands.
author: Andy Z.

description: I've been going to this place for about 30 years. It remains excellent and the other branches around the bay are very similar. I like the mile enchilada best. Good margaritas too. Chips, rice and beans complete the meal. Get the pequeno size unless you have lots of room.
author: Tony P.

description: We were so happy to come back! We went on a Wednesday night and it was bustling. Decor was much improved. Food was excellent. And service was good enough. Can't wait to go back!
author: Wendy H.

description: Great neighborhood spot. Everyone at Celia's is friendly (staff and guests) and it has a very relaxed vibe. The food is great and a great value. It's my favorite place in the neighborhood to watch games- they've got a projector screen against one wall in the bar. Best value- Taco Tuesdays.
author: Lillian W.
