description: Wtf happened to the free guac with check in?? That really  was the only saving grace for their somewhat-better-than-mediocre food.
author: Matt F.

description: Good food, great margaritas. Was searching for food and it was the only place in the area that was open after 10 on a Saturday night!
author: M S.

description: Good food. I had the fajitas. Very yummy. Drinks (margaritas) are a bit pricy though.
author: Hula H.

description: I don't like their watered down mole and red sauce....  Food was mediocre, too many other good options in SF to eat yummy Mexican food, don't waste your time here.
author: shimmerSF M.

description: free guac /w checkin. good drinks
author: Matt A.

description: not too bad, kind of packed during happy hour or taco tuesday and the margaritas can be a bit salty. Food is overpriced but good atmosphere and fun to go to if you are local
author: Max O.

description: We went with my daughter and her fiance, who had eaten at this restaurant before. I enjoyed the margarita--not too strong. I ordered the enchiladas with mole. It was not the best mole I had ever had. It was too thick and not very complex. I did enjoy my enchilada once I scraped most of it off and the fish taco I tasted was super.
author: cathy s.

description: I recently took my family to Celia's during a visit from VT, and had an enjoyable meal.  I had the fish and shrimp tacos, which were pretty good - though, they could have been a bit more flavorful.  The mole sauce was especially popular with my group, though I would avoid it if you are not one for spicy foods, as it packs some heat.  The ambiance was quiet, and typical in colors and styling to your quintessential Mexican cantina.  They carry an extensive selection of beers, and their margaritas were very tasty.  Service was polite and prompt.  Prices seemed aligned with my expectations for the quality and portions of food we received.  Overall, I would eat here again.
author: Virginia B.

description: I really love this place!! The chicken mole enchiladas were the best I have ever tastes and the Cancun platter was outstanding!!! Muy bueño!!! I can't wait to visit again!! It's not a fancy setting with fancy plates and glasses it just real good food!! Even the chips and salsa made me feel like I was eating at a family members house.. Fresh and authentic!!
author: Tammaneka B.

description: the best little sunset gem! this place is just awesome. there's never a wait, even on weekends. endless chips and salsa..try the green salsa!!! enchiladas, fajitas, and tostada salad are alllll good picks :)
author: Nikki W.

description: Great atmosphere, fun and friendly staff, good reggae music.  It's relaxing sitting at the bar watching a baseball game sipping a signature spicy margarita and dipping warm chips in their epic salsa.  It's a good neighborhood spot and I always have a good time there.
author: Shyam B.

description: Finally went to Celia's last weekend & loved it. Started off with a few margaritas that & had seafood tacos. Food was delicious & the service was great! I definitely will come back!
author: Ava O.

description: I have been to Ceila's by the Beach numerous times. They have a great jalapeno margarita and recently improved their food. But tonight I went in and ordered a salad with carne asada. The salad itself was $6.15 and the added meat $5,00, totaling $11.15. It was made clear to my server Jill that this was to be my entree. I was not told when I ordered that the salad was simply a side salad. When it was served on a 6 inch plate with just lettuce and tomato, and a few measly croutons, with a little bit of steak on the top and a tiny ramekin of dressing on the side, I questioned the size of the salad costing $11.15, and which was not described on the menu or by her as a "side" salad. I asked if I could get it on a dinner size plate with a little more lettuce and a couple of more slices of tomato. She agreed and said she understood my complaints, but suggested that I would have to talk to a manager. I said that I understood and waited patiently for a manager. He/She did not arrive. Instead Jill came back, stating she had talked to her manager. The only way they could accommodate my request, other than having me order something entirely different on the menu, was for me to pay for 2 dinner salads ($12.30) plus meat ($5.00), totaling $17.30. I questioned this hefty price just to get a little more lettuce, couple of slices of tomato and a bigger plate to eat it on. She said that is what her manager had insisted on so again I would have to wait for him/her to discuss. I would have been more than happy to pay a few extra dollars but not double the price, which seemed ridiculous and Jill seemed to agree. After having asked now twice and waited to see a manager, I declined and left as my patience had run out. Kindly Jill bought me my margarita and that was much appreciated, as my dinner and time at Ceilia's had been ruined by their cheap attitude and failure of the manager to deal with me personally or giving Jill the authority to do what it took to make the customer happy. When I worked in the business giving a larger salad was never a big deal and in fact was encouraged. It was not the money it was the principle. BTW got an amazing large salad, with beans, red peppers, tons of fresh avocado, better salsas and at least twice as much meat La Playa Taqueria down the street for $9.  They even threw in some fresh red peppers at no extra charge. Also Underdogs Taco on Irving has an incredible large steak salad with lots more goodies than Ceilia's sucky salad for a mere $7.75. Furthermore, the manager could not even take the time to initially come by and speak to me, instead sending Jill to do the "dirty work," and give no satisfying alternatives to remedy the situation. For a neighborhood restaurant Ceila's was not very accommodating and cheap! Again, thank you Jill for the comped margarita but would have preferred a little extra lettuce and larger plate.
author: Alexandra R.

description:
Six of us enjoyed dinner at Celia's last Sunday.  I like the decor, with the pastel pink and green walls.  The place does not have a modern look, but a spruced up look, maintaining the "retroness".  We were promptly served chips and two salsas.  One pitcher of house Margaritas gave each of us a brimming glass, and that was plenty for a toast and a slosh!

My combo of chicken enchilada verde and pork tamal was huge.  Although the masa on the tamal was a little tough (always the downfall of tamals) the meat inside was really tender and flavorful.  Also with the enchilada, the shredded chicken was delicious and fork tender.  I'm a sucker for refried beans, and mine didn't disappoint! The surprise was the rice; it was extremely delicious, subtly spiced and moist without being clumpy.

My friends ordered all kinds of things from fish tacos to steak to fajitas, and everyone enjoyed their food.

Our server (I wish I got her name...maybe the manager can deduce who she was based on the date and time, 6pm, and we were in the back dining room) was extremely attentive and friendly.  She regularly checked on us, had our tortilla chips and salsas replenished, made sure we had water, etc.

Have you noticed that what ticks people off most about a restaurant experience (whether it's a fancy place or a neighborhood joint) is the service?  When you have really good service, you overlook some little food gaffes (like the masa!).

Would enjoy a return visit.  Parking isn't as easy as you might expect, this being the outer Sunset, so just take note.

Thank you, mystery server!  I hope you get a "kudos" from your boss;  you've got one from me!
author: Jan C.

description: This place has a relaxed family atmosphere and fantastic prices on food and drinks. I have never had a bad bite of food at Celia's and the Wednesday house margaritas are a are always great.
author: Allen W.

description: I have been dancing around the menu at Celia's for the last year since the remodel.  I like to get the Tortilla Soup, cheese on side as it is a melty cheese.  I actually prefer cotija or a non melter, but that is me.  Last time I got the Veggie Fajitas and they were substantial and fantastic.  I also like the Avocado Tostada.  The Quesadilla is pretty yum and a good appetizer to share.  We get the guacamole all the time it is good but could be bumped up with more lime and fresh jalapeño.  The margaritas are good and dangerous.
author: Carey C.

description: margarita is very strong.  two glasses and i am drunk.  food is not bad.  goos atmosphere
author: D F.

description: Great margaritas! I usually order the fajitas and they are pretty good as well. Enough for two meals. The menu is basic but good. Check in on Yelp for free guacamole.
author: Thomas S.

description: Not only was Raul the best busser I have ever met, the food was great and the drinks were better. Chat it up with one of the owners at the bar. Even though they're Giants fans, they're still good guys.
author: Eric S.

description: This is probably the worst Mexican food I've ever been served. Being Mexican, I find the food they serve at Celia's insulting. Nothing tasted fresh. Salsa tastes like it came out of a jar, the tortillas clearly come out of a package, the carnitas my son had looked really dry. I had the Chile Relleno and it was incredibly bad: the sauce was runny like watered-down tomato puree and so tasteless, the cheese inside was barely warm not melted, the batter-merengue a Chile Relleno is supposed to be coated with was replaced by what seem to be an omelette wrapped around a California chile; anyone who knows what a Chile Relleno is supposed to be, will tell you that only Poblano peppers are used to make this very simple dish. This is the kind of restaurant that gives Mexican food a bad name. I can assure you that real Mexican cuisine is nothing like this.
author: Teresa B.

description: Good and solid food, good beer, very friendly people. I reco this place if you dig mex food.
author: Dave T.

description: I came here with some friends after they had recommended it to me and my wife.  The location was convenient and we didn't have any problems parking.  The food and drinks were good as well.  What I liked most about this place was the vibe.  Employees seem happy, good music, TVs and a projector by the bar.  You just feel relaxed here like it's the weekend no matter what day you go there.
author: Kevin K.

description:
I would like to start out that I tried Celias Daly City a while back for a birthday party and food, service and atmosphere were great.  So yesterday a friend wanted to try the Sunset restaurant since he heard it was remodeled, it looked nice, clean...we were off to a good start with the greeting/seating when we walked in and pretty much ended there also, we ordered from our waitress and it took about 15 minutes to get my coke and his margarita(and we were the only customers there at 4:30), the food came 20 minutes later, but the food wasn't nothing to write positive reviews for.

We were having our dinner and not once did anybody come back and ask how we were and if we needed anything, that was disappointing since my buddy wanted to order more...he was hungry but since the waitress didnt ask if we needed anything else while we were eating he didn't order anything more.  All we heard was reggae playing(I like reggae but was expecting latin/mexican music so it through the Mexican vibe out the window) at a Mexican restaurant and just heard the crew talk amongst each  other while we were waiting for someone to check on us, and at the end we just wanted the bill(even though weren't in a rush).   We finally had to ask for the bill and received it, we wanted to pay with credit but 5 minutes in she didn't even come back to process payment, we ended up just leaving cash with a tip(that was the change) even though she didnt deserve one...we just wanted to pay, leave and never come back. 

1. service slow, and inattentive (maybe a off day, on the contrary to other reviews saying great servcie, I don't know because we are never going back). There were about 6 employees(including cook) only the 2 customers(us) and not a one of them asked us how we were until we asked for our check which would not have came if we didn't ask for it.

2. food was just ok (nothing to say "you gotta go to Celias by the Beach and try the Tamale/Enchilada"), which I had.

3. maybe on a weekend if you want to go the the bar to just drink and have appetizers it will be cool, but to dine-in and expect what a restaurant should be, thumbs down.  You'd be better off going to the mission district and order/pay at a counter, seat yourself, get your own food when it's ready(which would be twice as good for half the price) and you'd get better service then at Celias SF.

4. $40 for 2 dishes and 2 beverages just to have your food delivered to the table. .
author: D C.

description: Best Mexican food in SF. I'm just disappointed it took me years to find it! I've been here a handful of times for dinner and the food has been delicious every time. On a Friday night, their margaritas are hard to top. A big plus: the friendly and efficient service. Totally worth a trek to the Outer Sunset, especially to support a family business. I'll be back soon!
author: Kelly M.

description: Hey, CELIA'S HAS RE-OPENED (June 2012) and the MARGARITAS are still AWESOME! And the menu has improved! One year and five months without those margaritas was quite a drought. I think the kitchen was totally remodeled, and the dining area was refreshed. It looks really great, but it's still the same booths and tables, so don't expect an entire remodel of the dining area. The murals are really lovely. The entryway looks great, the bar area looks nice (new TVs), and the dining area has a fountain with lovely artwork surrounding it. Celia's grandson Phil came to each table and thanked everyone for coming in, which means a lot. There are a few new menu items, including amazing carnitas fajitas with pineapple! It was excellent and a really big portion (lunch the next day). We also had enchiladas with shredded beef -- as good as ever. Service was a little slow, but everyone was extremely friendly - lots of smiles from all the all new wait staff who were dressed in black, well-groomed, and looked sharp. I was surprised that the place was so packed! It's only been open for 3 days and we watched every table fill up on a Tuesday night. Obviously, the neighborhood missed Celia's.
author: michelle b.

description: i've been going here since the 70's. turning it into a Chili's clone not a great idea. my last diinner felt and tasted micro-nuked. very bland (just like Chili's). pls go back to what made you a great place to eat AUTHENIC Mex !  Not Chili's junk food. just say 'n....
author: David R.

description: Lets just get down to the nitty gritty.  Food was ok, but charging for refill on ice tea? Omg a few tea bags and some water  whats the big deal? I would understand if it was flavored. Then when we got our bill we were charged for tortillas, man that should come with the meals. Most mexican restaurant's in San Francisco give you tortillas with your meals. SERVICE WAS SLOW. Ran out of several item early like crab nachos and crab enchiladas.
author: Peter C.

description: Very pleased Celia's By The Beach has opened. The place looks great and is very friendly. Another great addition to the Outer Sunset to gather for a yummy meal. They have something for everyone in our three generation household. We like the new menu-  but greatly appreciate the old menu favorites! Mom and her senior friends are gathering for dinner there again and have good things to say, my husband is a fan of the Perfecto Special Combo,  I enjoyed trying small plates and appetizers with friends and having very good drinks at the cantina, watching Giants games, meeting new folks and catching up on outerlands news and goings on! We walk there, but the NJUDAH and 18Sloat bus, stops on the block where Celia's is. Parking is fairly easy in the neighborhood. Enjoy!
author: Maggie M.

description: We went to Taco Tuesday this week!!!! I wish i lived in the area on a full time basis.  Great addition (or re-addition so i'm told) to the neighborhood! The food isn't stellar but it's just nice to have somewhere else to go.
author: Babs B.

description: This place is the best!!  Exceptional service!  Huge food selection, and the staff did an amazing job explaining items on the menu and pointing out favorites.  You need to try the organic margaritas, they were great!  Can't wait to come back and try more things!
author: Phil S.

description: I have had two viists to the New Celia's By The Beach!  I love the remodeling which kept, for the most part, the flavor of the original Celia, a family choice.  I liked the refried beans. If the rice & beans are good, the rest should follow.  A little bit pricey for me!  Give them a chance to get rolling.  Staff a little over zealous but they will calm down. Owners are very sociable and sincere.  Great fit into the neighborhood (again). I was there for the beginning of Celia's in the 50's.  Welcome back, La Familia!
author: Diane R.

description: Ah Celia's! Finally back and getting better each visit! I've been in the hood for 30 years now, was familiar with the previous Celia's, and toward the end of that era we only tolerated it as it went down so fast. Then we had to wait ?,what a year and a half? Oh ya, a daily chat of Judah....when are they opening back up? So now after several tweaks (they had a rough start), they are rockin'! It is a very festive place, the food has become much better, they have specials (happy hour?), taco Tuesday is a blast and a deal, and it has become a very popular gathering place for the locals. My only concern (and it is really no biggie) is that the wait staff is very green, young, and on every visit there has been a major issue of incompetency that has screwed up our dinner. However we have always had good luck sitting at the bar, as there are a couple of very professional bartenders there...or was. Ryan isn't around anymore but Erica is amazing and runs that sh** like a top. And very pleasant...I hope to God they can hang onto her. So that is my only star ding...a more professional staff, but yes I am a big fan!
author: punk l.
